title: (CI/CD) Pipelines Testers
description:
GAMA-1 Technologies, LLC seeks a highly experienced remote **Quality Assurance Automation Engineer specializing in Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment (CI/CD) Pipelines.** The candidate will support GAMA-1's growing Cloud Services practice. In particular, the successful candidate will help drive GAMA-1's efforts to support the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration's (NOAA) Cloud and National Environmental Satellite, Data, and Information Service (NESDIS) initiatives. These strategic cloud initiatives intend to increase the bureau's IT efficiency, improve IT delivery, and reduce costs.

***Supervisory Responsibilities:***
===================================

* Non-Supervisory Role

**Duties/Responsibilities:**
----------------------------


The Quality Assurance Specialist/Tester will support NESDIS satellite ground systems infrastructure and the common services they provide to our global stakeholder community. These systems and services are deemed mission-critical technologies that receive, process, disseminate, store, and archive petabytes of environmental data and information collected from space daily in support of environmental science and the global stakeholder community. The candidate will be responsible for all aspects of quality assurance and compliance with applicable federal regulatory requirements to enhance existing and developing capabilities.


The Quality Assurance Specialist/Tester will work with a team responsible for transitioning scientific satellite ground systems and environmental intelligence data and applications from an on-prem infrastructure environment to the AWS cloud platform without interruption to operations. The candidate will work closely with environmental science teams and stakeholders to: conduct a standard set of project reviews; generate a standard set of documentation; develop and refine requirements; track risks and mitigations; clean code for coding/security, apply common data formats, metadata, and compliances; adhere to standard languages, tools, and libraries; test software; validate products, perform configuration management; and prepare the systems or applications for migration.

**Duties:**

* Utilize CI/CD tools integration, operations, and automation of CI testing
* Troubleshoot issues along the CI/CD pipeline
* Write clean, high-quality scripts that test product functionality automatically.
* Identify and create standard test environments to support system, integration, UAT, and modeling during system and application migrations to a cloud environment
* Conduct various tests for systems, networks, applications, databases, and software.
* Log and document errors in the tracking system.
* Identify specific cases that should be automated and discuss them with manual QA engineers.
* Develop the best automation solutions based on the client’s requirements.
* Participate in Sprint planning to define the sprint scope.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to find ways on how automation can improve the workflow.
* Cooperate with a development team to formulate the tasks and explain post-release user feedback.
* Gather requirements and prepare Requirements Allocation Documents. Provide requirement support to each migration project and ensure traceability.
* Prepare presentations and required materials to lead and conduct project system or application migration reviews
* Conduct audits and reviews/analyzes data and documentation
* Determine and prepare documentation necessary for quality assurance and compliance
* Administer the quality and compliance control processes for software/system development for all migration work assignments
* Develop and maintain, as needed, QM processes, plans, policies, Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs), work instructions, and other documents.
* Responsible for operations of the test environments, including refreshing the environments
* Works closely with the infrastructure team to make sure the environments are up to date with requirements for migration to the cloud platform
* Identify and administer testing related tools and make sure the quality control tools are up to date with the latest patches
* Provide quality assurance testing for all systems to ensure the migration to the cloud is without disruption to operations
* Produce lists of issues/conflicts/problems that are to be resolved and incorporated into future migrations as required.
* Communicate with all parties about formal testing plans, problems, and results before migration
* Manage the quality assurance and control process for all changes to the baseline IT infrastructure
* Ensure all existing migration processes are fully documented, suggesting improvements, updating documentation, and communicating all process changes to relevant stakeholders

**Required Skills/Abilities:**

* 6+ years as QA tester
* 3-5 years of CI/CD testing and/or engineering support
* Demonstrated experience creating metrics and result from CI/CD tools
* Strong understanding of DevOps methodology and continuous integration & continuous delivery (CI/CD) concepts and practices.
* Demonstrated experience with Amazon Web Services, code-defined Infrastructure, quality management tools, and CI/CD
* Hands-on experience with JMeter or QMetry Test Management system (preferred)
* Familiarity with environmental science concepts and systems is a plus.
* Experience with IT Infrastructure, Quality Management, and Compliance tools
* Experience with Agile life cycle process.
* Basic understanding of cloud computing technologies, IT business drivers, and emerging computing trends, technologies, and strategies (including IaaS, PaaS, Security, Compute, Storage, and networking)
* Knowledge of hardware and software configuration management concepts, goals, benefits, and standard strategies to achieve those goals
* Familiarity with scripting language skills is required in Java, PHP, PowerShell, Bash, Perl, Ruby, or Python preferred.
* Experience with SCM tools such as Git, GitLab, ClearCase, etc.
* Experience with JIRA RoadMaps, Xray, Zephyr, and other JIRA modules is preferred.
* Experience documenting and providing training on quality and compliance processes, work instructions, etc.
* Experience and understanding of large-scale infrastructure deployments in enterprise-wide environments required
* Excellent written, verbal, and analytical skills
* Ability to obtain a Public Trust Clearance
* United States Citizen

***Desired:***

* Experience supporting and control during Critical Mission Operational Systems and Applications migrations from on-prem infrastructure to cloud platform environments is required.
* **Preferred Certification** - AWS Certified DevOps Engineer – Professional or AWS Cloud Practioner, ASQ Certified Software Quality Engineer (CSQE)

**Education and Experience:**
-----------------------------

* BS/BA in Computer Science, a Technical Field, or other related disciplines OR 6+ years of experience large scale IT Enterprise Infrastructure Quality Assurance and Control Management Experience

title: Senior Load, Scalability, and Performance Tester - Remote
description:
**Company Overview**


TestPros is a successful and growing business, established in 1988 to provide Information Technology (IT) technical support services to a wide range of Commercial and U.S. Federal, State, and Local Government customers. Our capabilities include Program Management, Program Oversight, Process Audit, Intelligence Analysis, Cyber Security, NIST SP 800-171 and CMMC Assessment and Compliance, Computer Forensics, Software Assurance, Software Testing, Test Automation, Section 508 and WCAG Accessibility Assessment, Localization Testing, Independent Verification and Validation (IV&V), Quality Assurance (QA), Compliance, and Research and Development (R&D) services. TestPros is an Equal Opportunity Employer.


TestPros delivers innovative independent IT assessment solutions to critical challenges facing the nation and the world. We support the U.S. Federal Government and Commercial clients within the continental USA. TestPros is dedicated to making lives better, safer and more secure.

**Job Summary**


TestPros is seeking to fill a remote Performance Test Engineer position. The ideal candidate will develop advanced test automation frameworks and test automation scripts using tools such as HP LoadRunner, HP Performance Center, JMeter, LoadUI, and Rational Performance Tester.


Position: Full Time


Location: Remote


Clearance: Active Public Trust Clearance (VA clearance preferred)


Citizenship: U.S. citizenship is required

**Responsibilities**

* Participate in full testing life cycle as part of a high-performing team.
* Establish test automation approaches based upon system design.
* Develop and execute automated tests.
* Edit / develop test automation scripts for load, performance, and benchmark testing.
* Work in collaboration with the customer and other contractors to ensure that testing is completed in a timely manner.
* Conduct proof of concept research into new tools, methods, and test strategy to improve load and performance testing.
* ‪Enhance and expand the current test architecture and framework, driving improvements and innovations in our performance testing process and methodology.
* Provide status to Program Management during regular meetings.

**Required Qualifications & Skills**

* U.S. Citizenship.
* Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, Business, Project Management, or other related discipline. 8 years of additional relevant experience may be substituted for education.
* At least 5 years of performance testing, and engineering experience.
* Experience with containers and Kubernetes.
* Strong Automation and coding skills using Shell, Groovy, Java, C# or other languages.
* Proficient in On-Prem and Cloud (AWS) performance testing.
* Strong knowledge of various load testing tools such as JMeter, Blazemeter/Grafana, OctoPerf, LoadRunner, etc.
* Hands on experience with test automation, test tool scripting (HTTP and other web protocols), VB script, JavaScript, Python, Perl, PHP, C++, XML, SQL, etc.
* Hands on experience in APM tools like Dynatrace/NewRelic/AppDynamics/Splunk.
* Strong knowledge of Splunk (and/or Splunk) to build effective visualizations, alerts and dashboards around key business transitions, performance, and health metrics to get deeper operational and system insight on the systems.
* Good knowledge in analyzing performance logs using ELK/Splunk.
* Strong analyzing/data mining skills using SQL.
* Experience on Kafka/messaging performance testing will be an added advantage.
* Strong in performance engineering concepts and CPU/Memory bottleneck analysis.
* Experience working with test automation frameworks.
* Possess full knowledge of industry standard SDLCs, including Agile methodology.
* Able to communicate effectively and clearly present technical approaches and findings.

**Preferred Qualifications & Skills**

* Possession of one of these (or other) certifications is a plus:
	+ ISTQB Agile Tester Foundation Level Extension.
	+ Certified Agile Tester by QA.
	+ Fundamentals of Agile Certification by ICAgile.
	+ Certified Scrum Master by Scrum Alliance.

**Benefits**


TestPros offers a competitive salary, medical/dental/vision insurance, life insurance, paid time off, paid holidays, 401(k) retirement plan with company match, Long-Term and Short-Term Disability Insurance, opportunities for professional growth, cell phone discounts, and much more! All benefits are per TestPros current policies and are subject to change without notice. Benefits are available to full-time employees.


TestPros, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

**EEO Statement**


All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, age, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability. VEVRAA Federal Contractor.

title: QA Tester (Contract)
description:
Sawhorse is a dynamic and innovative creative studio based in Los Angeles that thrives on pushing the boundaries of immersive experiences. We specialize in crafting captivating digital worlds and interactive projects. Our team is made up of passionate creators who are dedicated to delivering exceptional results. We're looking for a motivated QA Tester to join us in our mission.


As a QA Tester at Sawhorse Productions, you will collaborate closely with our talented developers to ensure the quality and excellence of our gaming experiences. The ideal candidate will excel at identifying and documenting bugs in gameplay and the 3D environment, possess excellent written communication skills, and have a keen eye for detail.


Responsibilities:

* Collaborate closely with our development team to identify and report bugs in gameplay and the 3D environment.
* Accurately describe bug reproduction steps and meticulously document the test environment for effective debugging.
* Utilize your strong written communication skills to clearly articulate bug reports, ensuring developers have the necessary information for efficient troubleshooting and resolution.
* Track the progression of bug fixes from the initial report through to validation in the test environment, maintaining detailed records throughout the process.
* Work closely with cross-functional teams to understand game design specifications and provide feedback on potential issues during the development lifecycle.
* Perform rigorous regression testing to ensure that resolved issues do not introduce new problems.
* Contribute to the continuous improvement of testing processes and methodologies.
* Efficiently manage and prioritize testing tasks using task tracking systems, with a strong emphasis on proficiency in tools like JIRA.

**Requirements**

* Proven experience as a QA Tester or in a similar role within the game development industry.
* In-depth knowledge of game testing methodologies, including experience with bug tracking, reproduction, and validation processes.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen attention to detail.
* Excellent written communication skills with the ability to convey complex technical information clearly and concisely.
* Familiarity with task tracking systems such as JIRA is a strong plus.
* Passion for gaming and a deep understanding of game mechanics and 3D environments.
* Ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced development environment.
* Proactive attitude with the ability to take initiative and suggest process improvements.

**Benefits**


SALARY RANGE

* $8/hour-$15/hour

  

LOCATION/SCHEDULE


This role can be based in the Los Angeles office or remote. This position is generally operating during West Coast hours M-F 9:00 AM - 6:00 PM.

are evaluated on the basis of their qualifications, consistent with applicable state and federal laws.


In addition, Sawhorse Productions will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals


with disabilities. Sawhorse Productions will consider for employment qualified applicants with


criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable state and federal law.

title: Quality Assurance Tester/Analyst
description:
**QUALITY ASSURANCE TESTER/ANALYST (QAT)**  


**Position Summary:**
The Quality Assurance Tester/Analyst (QAT) is responsible for bridging application outcomes with business expectations. This position will play a significant role in assuring our constituents that new applications, enhancements, and issues are adequately tested against key specifications. The position will be accountable for collaborating with vendors, business, and technical teams. Data collection, evaluation and presentation are core deliverables. As part of the QAT team, this individual is expected to champion continuous improvement using both automated and manual means to provide reporting, manage defects and sign off on functionality. The Quality Assurance Tester/Analyst will play a critical role in System Integration Testing (SIT) for the Implementation and testing efforts for beyond implementation.
**Position Responsibilities:**
* Develop test plans, test scripts and traceability matrices. Documentation of outcomes against criteria
* Implement and execute automated test cases and analyze outputs to maximize product quality
* Perform all forms of product testing, including exploratory, functional, integration, usability, regression, and performance testing
* Catalog software defects and collaborate with business, technical and data teams to ensure they are resolved and thoroughly retested
* Analyze test coverage for existing and new tests regularly, incorporate feedback into regression testing activities
* Participate in product/application release meetings including kickoffs, daily stand-up and information sharing sessions
* Drive continuous improvements of testing including feedback to deliver higher quality solutions
* Experience writing SQL queries, creating ETL test data and mapping ETL rules to test functionality


Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.
**Position Qualifications:**
============================


**Required**
* B.S. Degree in computer science, business administration or equivalent certification/experience
* Minimum of 3 years in QAT roles

**Preferred**
* Health Rules Payer experience
* SmartBear/JIRA and Time Management experience
* SQL, API, and data flow experience
* Experience in Insurance and/or HealthCare technology related industry

**Skills,** **Knowledge,** **and Abilities**
* Capable of building and maintaining strong, productive working relationships with internal and external partners
* Proven track record of detail-oriented problem solver
* Excellent oral and written communication skills
* Exceptional customer service, and interpersonal skills
* Strong organizational, self-motivation, and decision-making skills
* Proficiency using Microsoft programs (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
* Ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment
* Ability to work independently and collaboratively, as needed

  

*MedCost provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.*

title: Remote Software Tester
description:
Here at **UN****COMN**, our mission is to empower systems thinkers to create elegant solutions to complex problems – to improve the systems that improve our communities. Our team members apply their natural curiosity and grit to discover elegant solutions for our clients’ most complex organizational, logistics, process, data, and technical challenges, with the overall goal of building great businesses that contribute to great communities.  



We’re an award-winning firm, one of the country’s fastest-growing and—more importantly—a consistent ‘**Top Workplace**’ as evaluated by our own employees. We are a values-driven organization (see the **Core Values** section of our website) and we’re looking for new Uncommon Geniuses to join our growing team, so if you’re a person who likes to solve problems, fix things, build things, tweak things, or otherwise show creative flair, you might just be an "**UN****COMN** Genius" and we encourage you to check out the specifics of this position below!  


**UN****COMN** is seeking a **Software Tester** to play a pivotal role in the modernization of legacy processing systems with the overall goal of improving client experience, increasing voluntary compliance, and reducing reliance on costly and unsustainable legacy technology. In this role, you'll get to:


* Be at the forefront of high-level automation, applying top-tier quality engineering principles to ensure our products not only meet but exceed specifications.
* Collaborate closely with engineers and the development team, leveraging automated testing tools to craft streamlined test processes.
* Support the entire spectrum of product and system testing, covering everything from function and component evaluation to system, performance, regression, and service testing.
* Actively participate in software team meetings, design reviews, peer reviews, and other relevant gatherings where your insights will shape the direction of our projects.
* Set up test environments, design effective test plans, and create compelling test cases, scenarios, and usage cases.
* Provide technical and administrative direction, ensuring software development tasks align with our goals.
* Make a lasting impact and be a part of transformative projects, while simultaneously epitomizing UNCOMN's core values and being a driving force behind software excellence.
* May travel to St. Louis, MO and/or San Antonio, TX, 1-2 times/year, otherwise, remote within the US
* Five (5) or more years of related experience
* Bachelor's Degree from an accredited college or university or an additional four (4) years of related experience
* Must be eligible to pass and obtain an IRS Minimum Background Investigation (MBI) and a security clearance as needed, which requires US Citizenship
* Deep understanding of software development fundamentals, requirements, and the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC)
* Experience with COBOL or IBM Mainframe/ALC programming language in a Z/OS environment
* Ability to perform complex tasks with minimal supervision and guidance
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Effective time management, scheduling, and organizational skills

  


**Preferred**


* Active IRS MBI or Treasury Public Trust highly preferred
* Prior experience working in an Agile development environment
* Experience with Java, MongoDB, AWS/Azure, Endevor Mainframe DevOps software, and/or IBM tools like Debug/Debugger, TSO, ISPF, and File Manager
* Prior professional experience working in highly regulated environments, preferably within Financial/Banking Services

**\\*\\*Position is contingent upon award\\*\\***


* Flexible PTO effective on day 1\\*
* 7 Paid Holidays & up to 3 Floating Holidays\\*
* Eligible for Health Benefits on day 1\\*
* 401K Safe Harbor Match Program\\*
* Training and Education Assistance\\*
+ *Must be a full-time employee*

  


**Don’t meet every single requirement? You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.**

title: Lead Automated Test Engineer
description:
Overview:

Are you inquisitive? Thorough? Diplomatic? Ever worked as part of a program that is Agile? Are you interested in being an agent of change on a team committed to achieving client-focused, mission-driven excellence?

  

Steampunk is seeking a **Lead Automated Test Engineer** who will provide testing and QA expertise in mission critical work across our client base.

  

Responsibilities will include testing and verification of code, reporting and recording defects, coordination with architects, functional analysts, and developers on testing and testing results, documenting test scripts, participating in design reviews, user acceptance testing, and deployment activities. This individual will also work in an Agile environment and participate in scrum ceremonies and product planning activities.


Contributions:

As a **Lead Automated Test Engineer**, you will work with our growing DevSecOps practice delivering quality assurance services to support application, cloud and data systems development. Responsibilities include:

* Understanding the needs of stakeholders and conveying this to developers
* Meet with product design team to determine testing parameters
* Write test plans, create test cases, test procedures, bug reports, final QA reports for products
* Manage test data architecture definition and requests
* Troubleshoot errors and streamline the test procedures
* Testing and examining code written by others and analyzing results, including three or more of the following:
* Data validation testing
* Functional testing
* Performance and load testing
* Usability testing
* Accessibility (508) testing
* Establishing automated testing tools and infrastructure for test automation
* Provide validation testing of different system and data sets for cloud migrations
* Develop automated testing scripts considering parallelization and idempotency
* Automate and improve development, testing, deployment, and release processes
* Ensuring that systems are safe and secure against cybersecurity threats
* Working with software developers and software engineers to ensure that development follows established processes and works as intended
* Document as-is state of the environment, perform a gap analysis, and produce artifacts that articulate options and recommendations
* Leverage virtualization and containerization to optimize testing software systems
* Work with teams to bring continuous improvement to DevSecOps processes and tools
* Engineer and implement solutions and provide recommendations for continuous improvement for the services provided
* Present regular status updates and provide cross training to other DevSecOps team members
* Act as an individual contributor and mentor more junior team members


Qualifications:
**Required:**

* U.S. Citizen
* Ability to obtain a U.S. government Security Clearance
* BS Degree in an IT field OR BS in a non-IT field and 2 years related IT experience
* At least 10+ years of experience in quality assurance testing
* 5 Years of Experience with Git SCM providers such as GitHub, GitLab, Bitbucket
* 5 Years of Experience with one or more programming or scripting languages
* 5 Years of application DevSecOps Experience with actual/active development experience in an Agile environment
* Experience utilizing docker containers and utilizing platforms such as Kubernetes
* 5 Years of Experience implementing test automation, using tools such as Selenium, Appium, Soap UI, RestAssured, Postman
* Experience integrating test automation including performance, security, and functional tests into CI/CD Pipelines
* Experience with performance and load testing
* Experience in one or more cloud computing environments (e.g. AWS, Azure, or GCP)

**Preferred:**

* Certifications:
	+ CAST (Certified Associate in Software Testing)
	+ International Software Testing Qualifications Board (ISTQB) Certification
	+ Certified Manager of Software Testing (CMST)
	+ DHS Trusted Tester Certification (TTv5)
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills, interpersonal and collaborative skills
* Experience with documenting an as-is state of the environment, perform a gap analysis, and produce artifacts that articulate options and recommendations preferred


About **steampunk**:

Steampunk is a **Change Agent** in the Federal contracting industry, bringing new thinking to clients in the Homeland, Federal Civilian, Health and DoD sectors. Through our **Human-Centered delivery methodology**, we are fundamentally changing the expectations our Federal clients have for true shared accountability in solving their toughest mission challenges. As an **employee owned company**, we focus on investing in our employees to enable them to do the greatest work of their careers – and rewarding them for outstanding contributions to our growth. If you want to learn more about our story, visit http://www.steampunk.com. *We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Steampunk participates in the E-Verify program.*

title: Salesforce Tester
description:
Overview:

As a **Salesforce Tester**, you will be an integral team member who assists the team in ensuring high quality code is delivered to our client. Responsibilities will include testing and verification of code, reporting and recording defects, coordination with architects, functional analysts, and developers on testing and testing results, documenting test scripts, participating in design reviews, user acceptance testing, and deployment activities. This individual will also work in an Agile environment and participate in scrum ceremonies and product planning activities.
Contributions:

As a Salesforce Tester, you will work with our growing DevSecOps & Salesforce practices delivering quality assurance services to support application, cloud and data systems development. We are looking for candidates with minimum 5 years experience with experience in quality assurance and test automation practices in an Agile/DevSecOps work environment. Responsibilities include:* Meet with product design team to determine testing parameters
* Write test plans, create test cases, test procedures, bug reports, final QA reports for products
* Manage test data architecture with the Tech Lead
* Troubleshoot errors and streamline the test procedures
* Testing and examining code written by others and analyzing results, including three or more of the following:
	+ Data validation testing
	+ Functional testing
	+ Performance and load testing
	+ Usability testing
	+ Accessibility (508) testing
* Establishing automated testing tools and infrastructure for test automation
* Provide validation testing of different system and data sets for Salesforce
* Understanding the needs of stakeholders and conveying this to developers
* Improve development, testing, deployment, and release processes
* Ensuring that systems are safe and secure against cybersecurity threats
* Working with software developers and software engineers to ensure that development follows established processes and works as intended
* Document as-is state of the environment, perform a gap analysis, and produce artifacts that articulate options and recommendations
* Work with teams to bring continuous improvement to DevSecOps processes and tools
* Engineer and implement solutions and provide recommendations for continuous improvement for the services provided
* Present regular status updates and provide cross training to other DevOps team members


Qualifications:
**Required:*** Must be a U.S. Citizen eligible to obtain and maintain a U.S. Government security clearance
* Bachelor's Degree required; equivalency offered
* 5 years of related experience in software/IT/cloud consulting
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills, interpersonal and collaborative skills
* Experience with documenting an as-is state of the environment, perform a gap analysis, and produce artifacts that articulate options and recommendations preferred

**Preferred:*** Certifications a plus:
	+ CAST (Certified Associate in Software Testing)
	+ International Software Testing Qualifications Board (ISTQB) Certification
	+ Certified Manager of Software Testing (CMST)
	+ DHS Trusted Tester Certification (TTv5)
* DevSecOps Experience with actual/active development experience in an Agile environment
* Experience with performance and load testing
* Experience utilizing docker containers and utilizing platforms such as Kubernetes
* Experience implementing test automation, using tools such as Selenium, Appium, Soap UI, RestAssured, Postman
* Experience integrating test automation including performance, security, and functional tests into CI/CD Pipelines


About **steampunk**:

Steampunk is a **Change Agent** in the Federal contracting industry, bringing new thinking to clients in the Homeland, Federal Civilian, Health and DoD sectors. Through our **Human-Centered delivery methodology**, we are fundamentally changing the expectations our Federal clients have for true shared accountability in solving their toughest mission challenges. As an **employee owned company**, we focus on investing in our employees to enable them to do the greatest work of their careers – and rewarding them for outstanding contributions to our growth. If you want to learn more about our story, visit http://www.steampunk.com. *We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Steampunk participates in the E-Verify program.*

title: Business Analyst/ Curam Tester
description:
Join a team dedicated to supporting the crucial mission of improving health outcomes.
At Merative, you can apply your skills – and grow new ones – with colleagues who have deep expertise in health and technology. Merative provides data, analytics and software for the health industry. Our clients include providers, health plans, employers, life sciences companies and governments around the world. With industry-leading products and focused innovation, we help customers improve decision-making and performance so that together, we drive real progress in health. Learn more at merative.com
Merative is a new and exciting company providing health and social care solutions to clients around the globe, with roots that go back more than 50 years. We are looking for dedicated professionals who share our ambitious future vision for transforming the provision of health and social care. The Social Program Management team Cúram within Merative has more than 30 years of experience in streamlining and supporting the delivery and administration of social support across the world.  

The decade ahead will see unprecedented changes in the management of population health as the drive to bring social care and healthcare together is realized by leveraging the capabilities of data management and advanced analytics.  

  

Merative is at the forefront of this change. We are working with some of the sectors most ambitious and forward-thinking partners and customers to transform the way populations are supported, and to improve the life chances for the most vulnerable people in our societies.
Principle Responsibilities & Duties* Verify that software functions according to functional and user requirements and software design specifications.
* Assist in the testing of systems, modules and prototypes.
* Report all defects in the group’s defect tracking tool; e.g., JIRA and Azure Dev Ops
* Conduct ongoing regression and integration testing of the product.
* Write, maintain, and execute system test plans and test cases/scripts.
* Perform installations, configurations and executions of verification procedures
* Prepare testing effort estimates based on design and requirements documents
* Draft test reports upon completion of test protocols
* Explore new methods for software verification and validation
* Work with Development and Technical teams to efficiently troubleshoot problems
* Assist in driving escalation process within Support
* Review installation, upgrade and system manuals
* Create Functionality vs. Requirements Traceability Matrices and Test Environment Matrices
* Maintain the testing environments.
* Pursue a program of self-development using selected reading, seminars, and participation in continuing education.
* Identify and communicate possible improvements in the work process for customers and peers.
* Perform other duties as assigned by immediate supervisor or upper management.


Basic Qualifications* 3-5 years working with Curam.
* Curam BA or Development Certification preferred.
* Thorough understanding of Software Quality Assurance methods
* Thorough understanding of various types of software testing (blackbox, stress, performance benchmarking, regression, etc.)
* Thorough understanding of Best Practice Workflow Methodologies from an application end user perspective (End to End Workflow)
* Familiarity with Windows and/or Linux\\Unix.
* Familiarity with test automation.
* Excellent oral and written communication skills
* Accuracy and strong attention to detail is essential.
* Ability to respond to urgent situations appropriately by prioritization.
* Ability to follow up with individuals without guidance.


Education Requirements* Bachelor of Science in Computer Science or Engineering or a related field or equivalent experience
* Five (5) years software testing experience

*It is the policy of Merative to provide equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, Merative will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities.**Merative participates in the federal E-Verify program to confirm the identity and employment authorization of all newly hired employees. For further information about the E-Verify program, please click here:* *http://www.uscis.gov/e-verify/employees*

title: ServiceNow Test Engineer (with SECRET clearance)
description:
ActioNet has an open opportunity for a **ServiceNow – Test Engineer.** This position is REMOTE. **Requires a SECRET level clearance.**


**Why** **ActioNet****?**  

It is simple. We are passionate about the inspirational missions of our customers and we entrust our employees and teams to deliver exceptional performance to enable the safety, security, health and well-being of our nation.


**Summary:**



ActioNet is looking for a ServiceNow - Test Engineer to support our DoD customer to implement an enterprise IT service delivery model that provides consistent, secure, high-quality, and cost-effective services to enable mission success and improve end user experience across the customer environment. On this program, ACTIONET will deliver enhanced capabilities and services to implement and operate an enterprise ITSM solution, enterprise service desk, endpoint management and security solution, as well as CONUS/OCONUS field support and life cycle support for end user devices to enable the DoD customer to transition focus from IT operations to mission operations.


The Software Tester will be responsible for establishing an automated framework for project integration, patch releases, and architectural design. Candidate will be expected to create, deliver, and maintain an overall test plan and test scenarios to include the methodology, approach, techniques, types of tests to be performed, and plan for conducting unit/component testing, integration testing, regression testing, performance testing, and user acceptance testing for all new integration and/or design projects.

  


**Roles and Responsibilities****:**


* Execute unit/component test procedures for all project components, create and execute integration test procedures, execute regression tests, coordinate and execute user acceptance testing, and create and execute performance tests. Components include applications, modules not part of an application, user interfaces
* Conduct component integration testing, which should include such items as performance and throughput benchmarking, fault tolerance, interface compliance, and functional completeness
* Support current production system break/fix and enhancement efforts to include requirements review, test formulation, test scenario preparation, test execution, and test summary preparation
* Document and analyze test results, produce status reports, and assist with the defect management process
* Ability to perform requirement analysis and work independently to create test products test plans, test cases, test reports of good quality
* Assist with technical artifacts including the Requirements Traceability Matrix, Use Cases, User Interface Specifications and migration plans
* Accurately estimate testing efforts for project planning and tracking and provide input to project(s) master schedule.
* Collect and report testing results to the architecture team and stakeholders on a regular basis
* Monitor defects so that they progress a timely manner and adhere to the defect tracking process/standards and ensure they are adequately retested when fixed
* Run performance benchmarks, conduct performance tuning and building capacity planning models.
* Identify potential testing or work product improvement.
* Provide informal demonstrations to staff and customers in conjunction with efforts
* Provide data re-processing testing and validation metrics.
* Document and track defects and change requests; provide input to and participate in the CCB process; capture and report defect metrics.
* Drive and implement automation process improvement items

  

**Qualifications****:**

* Experience with Microsoft Endpoint Configuration Manager (MECM/SCCM) and/or Microsoft Intune
* Experience with PowerShell scripting
* Package tests into suites for smoke/regression test execution
* Strong ServiceNow platform knowledge
* Experience testing in multiple ITSM modules.
* Manual ServiceNow testing
* Experience setting up test environments, executing test cases, and tracking defects
* Working experience with component, application, integration, and performance testing procedures and criteria
* Working experience in defining acceptance criteria and coordinating and executing acceptance testing
* Experience working with multiple teams and coordinating automation testing efforts for various integration projects
* Demonstrated initiative and ability to start, develop, and complete short and long term projects
* Demonstrates accuracy and thoroughness in the implementation of project specifications and design requirements
* Active DoD Secret Clearance
* 10+ Years of relevant experience (Bachelor’s Degree in relevant field may be substituted for 5 years of relevant experience; Master’s Degree in related field may be substituted for bachelor’s degree and 3 years relevant experience).

  


**Nice to Have:**

* Experience with relational databases (e.g., Microsoft SQL).
* Experience using ServiceNow Automated Test Framework (ATF)
* Ability to define and configure test automation using ServiceNow ATF
* Monitoring, fixing issues and maintaining ATF tests
* Experience with Business Rules, Script Includes, UI Actions, Scheduled Jobs - all scripted aspects of the ServiceNow system.
* Experience with utilizing Angular.JS, JavaScript, SQL and related technologies.
* Experience with ServiceNow client and server-side JavaScript and ServiceNow APIs.
* ServiceNow Certified System Administrator (CSA) certification or ability to obtain a CSA certification.
* Certified Implementation Specialist (ITSM, ITIL, CSM, or similar).

  


**What's in It** **For** **You?**  

  

As an ActioNeter, you get to be part of exceptional team and a corporate culture that nurtures mutual success for our customers, employees and our communities. We give you the tools to be successful; all you need to do is bring your best ideas, your energy and a desire to develop your skills, experience and career.  

  

**Are you ready to make a difference?**


*ActioNet* *is an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate* *on the basis of* *race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.*

title: QA Tester
description:
Founded by Bad Robot (Lost, Cloverfield, Westworld, Star Wars, Star Trek), we at Bad Robot Games are on a mission to continually reinvent how stories are played.



We are a **remote-first** games company represented by a diverse team, which empowers us to make the kinds of games in which all players can see themselves. Working closely with our colleagues at Bad Robot Productions, our projects unite our extensive network of games, TV, and film industry talent to create original IPs, expansive worlds and tell new stories across all media platforms which are as fun to watch as they are to play.


Bad Robot Games is seeking a tester to execute test cases and scenarios with attention to detail to help ensure the quality of the product.


**KEY RESPONSIBILITIES**


* Perform both functional and subjective testing and separate the two properly
* Test via End-to-end product testing (black box)
* Identify defects and write clear and concise steps to reproduce in bug reports
* Work alongside a small QA team to playtest the game, execute test passes, write bugs, investigate defects, and verify fixes
* Collaborate effectively with various teams, including but not limited to QA, Production, Engineering, Art, etc, to help track down defects and perform investigations


**KEY QUALIFICATIONS**


* Minimum 2 years experience testing games or equivalent experience
* Experience shipping at least 1 game title, working on a live product, or equivalent experience as a QA Game Tester
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Skilled troubleshooter
* Experience testing on multiple platforms
* Strong communication skills for a fully remote environment
* A general understanding of game development life cycles
* Experience with Jira or equivalent bug tracking software (DevTrack, etc.)
* Experience with black box testing
* All of our roles **require up to 10% air travel.** Examples include Studio/Team Offsites, Team/Studio Events, etc.


**BONUSES**


* Experience working with Game Engines (Unreal Preferred)
* Passion for Games and/or movies


Hourly Rate Range: $25.00 - $28.84



Our ranges are based on California market rate regardless of work location in the US.  


Find out more about our benefits and team on our careers page!



Bad Robot Games recruiters will never ask you for money or to provide financial information during our recruiting process. Scammers often request money transfers for Visa processing fees or travel expenses, as well as personal information including passport info, social security numbers, credit card or bank account information.Bad Robot Games recruiters will never use personal email (including @gmail) accounts when contacting candidates. We also do NOT interview or screen candidates over messenger or text-based chat. All communication will be tied to badrobotgames.com


**Bad Robot Games is an Equal Opportunity Employer.** All persons will receive consideration for employment without regard to gender (including gender identity, gender expression and gender reassignment), race (including colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin), religion or belief, marital or civil partnership status, disability, age, sexual orientation, pregnancy or maternity, trade union membership or membership in any other legally protected category.

title: Quality Assurance Tester
description:
We are looking for a skilled and experienced QA Tester with over 3 years of hands-on experience to ensure the quality of our software products. As a QA Tester, you will be responsible for testing applications, identifying and documenting defects, and collaborating with the development team to deliver high-quality software.

**Responsibilities:**

* Conduct thorough testing of software applications to identify defects and ensure functionality meets requirements.
* Perform both manual and automated testing as needed.
* Document and track identified defects, working closely with the development team for timely resolution.
* Collaborate with project teams to create comprehensive test plans based on project requirements.

* Strong understanding of software testing methodologies.
* Proficiency in both manual and automated testing.
* Good analytical and problem-solving skills.

If you have a passion for ensuring software quality and a proven track record in QA testing, we invite you to join our team!

title: Quality Assurance Analyst
description:
**Job Category:** Quality Assurance
**Job Type:** Lead
**Job Location:** Noida - India
CLOUDSUFI is a Data Science and Product Engineering organization building Products and Solutions for Technology and Enterprise industries. We firmly believe in the power of data to transform businesses and make better decisions. We combine unmatched experience in business processes with cutting edge infrastructure and cloud services. We partner with our customers to monetize their data and make enterprise data dance.


CLOUDSUFI is seeking a **Lead Quality Assurance**. The Lead is responsible for to oversee and manage the entire quality assurance process within a project and plays a crucial role in ensuring that the final product meets or exceeds customer expectation. Some of the key KPIs for this role are – Quality Planning, Team Management, Testing Strategy, Test Design & Execution, Defect Management, Process Improvement, Risk Management, Reporting & Communication.


### **Responsibilities**


* Leading a team of testers and be responsible for the quality of work
* Creating test plans and strategies
* Identifying and documenting defects
* Tracking Quality Assurance metrics (e.g. defect density, open defect count)
* Participating in daily stand-up meetings, sprint planning, and sprint retrospectives
* Coordinating with other teams to ensure timely delivery of quality software products
* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and meet deadlines
* Experience with test management tools (e.g. JIRA, Quality Center)


**Required Experience**


* Must have good programing expertise using **Java Script and Typescript**
	+ Must have executed more than 2 project end to end on Web Services layer testing (e.g. Rest API using Rest Assured, TestNG with Javascript or Typescript
	+ Must have experience Automation Tools – Appium and Playwright
	+ Must have experience with Selenium test automation using data driven test to validate and API calls using SOAP UI
	+ Should have experience of testing applications developed on Cloud Platforms- Azure, GCP, AWS; AWS preferred
	+ Should have experience of deploying the cloud applications using Dockers/ Containers
	+ Should have experience of integrating automation scripts with CI/CD Pipeline
	+ Experience with performance test automation using JMeter will be an added advantage
	+ Must have executed projects using Agile Scrum methodology and aware of all processes involved in Scrum
	+ Should be very well verse with current technology trends in IT Solutions e.g. Cloud Platform Development, DevOps, Low Code solutions, Intelligent Automation Participating in the entire lifecycle of projects – from requirement gathering to UAT sign-off
	+ Defining and monitoring productivity and efficiency of the testing teams through appropriate metrics.
	+ Proven experience in managing and facilitating the mix of internal teams and external vendors as a part of product buildout.
	+ Strong team building and people management skills are a must.

title: Quality Assurance Engineer
description:
**Sr. / Lead QA Engineer - Mobile Applications, Web Services, and Blockchain**

**Experience:** 10+ years

**Salary :** INR 2,50,000 / month

**Expected Notice Period**: 2 to 4 Weeks

**Shift**: 10:00AM to 6:00PM IST

**Opportunity Type:** Hybrid (Bengaluru)

**Placement Type:** Permanent

**(\\*Note: This is a requirement for one of Uplers' clients)**

**What do you need for this opportunity?**

**Primary Skills**:

Manual Testing, Team Collaboration, Mobile Testing Framework, Vendor Management, Performance Optimization, AWS Device Farm, Quality Assurance, Blockchain Testing, Selenium, Ci/Cd Pipelines,

**Assessment:** 

Role based AI Screening covering Communication and Technical Skills

**Our Hiring Partner is Looking for:**

Sr. / Lead QA Engineer - Mobile Applications, Web Services, and Blockchain who is passionate about their work, eager to learn and grow, and who is committed to delivering exceptional results. If you are a team player, with a positive attitude and a desire to make a difference, then we want to hear from you.

**Roles & Responsibilities**

**Mode of Work:** Hybrid, Bangalore (The Talent shall require to visit office for meetings, frequency to be discussed with the client)

Level & Grade: Senior/Lead Technology

Division/Dept.: Product Innovation

Reports to: Head of Product Innovation / Head of IT Operations

Date of Joining: Immediate

**Job Purpose:**

As a Senior/Lead Quality Assurance (QA) Engineer specializing in mobile applications, web services, and blockchain technologies, you will be instrumental in ensuring the quality, reliability, and security of our software products. Your role will involve leading the QA efforts, collaborating closely with development teams, and implementing comprehensive testing strategies across multiple platforms. You will play a critical role in shaping the user experience and maintaining the integrity of our digital solutions.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Leadership and Team Management: Lead and mentor a team of QA engineers, fostering a culture of excellence and innovation in both manual and automation testing practices.
* Test Strategy Development: Develop and implement comprehensive test strategies for mobile applications, web services, and blockchain solutions, encompassing both manual and automated testing approaches.
* Manual Testing: Conduct thorough manual testing of software applications, ensuring functionality, usability, and compatibility across various devices, browsers, and platforms.
* Automation Testing: Drive automation efforts for testing by designing, developing, and maintaining automated test suites using industry-standard tools and frameworks, such as Selenium, Appium, or Cypress.
* Test Planning and Execution: Plan and execute manual and automated test cases, scenarios, and scripts to achieve maximum test coverage and uncover potential defects.
* Cross-functional Collaboration: Collaborate closely with development teams, product managers, and stakeholders to ensure alignment of manual and automated testing activities with project requirements and timelines.
* Quality Assurance Standards: Define and enforce quality assurance standards and best practices for both manual and automated testing, ensuring consistency and reliability in testing processes.
* Defect Management: Identify, document, and track defects found during manual and automated testing, working closely with development teams to facilitate timely resolution and maintain product quality.
* Performance Optimization: Proactively identify performance bottlenecks through manual and automated testing, collaborating with development teams to optimize software performance and enhance user experience.
* Continuous Improvement: Drive continuous improvement initiatives within the QA team, incorporating feedback, lessons learned, and emerging technologies to enhance both manual and automated testing processes and methodologies.

**Engagement Type:**

* Direct-hire on the DigiYatra payroll
* Client / Talent Agreement - Full-time Permanent position
* The final salary CTC will be offered by the client based on the Interview performance, Current CTC and Technical Experience

\\*

**The Ideal Candidate:**

* Ready to play an Independent contributor role
* Ready to build strategy, roadmap and work with Tier I Vendors and coordinate on the project solutions and problem statements
* Jump In to solve the problems when the deadlines are about to miss
* Strong Project Management and Hands-on Expertise on Cloud Implementation
* Solution Centric and Work Independent
* The talents from Product Companies, B2B SaaS are most preferred for this role

**Project Requirements:**

* 10 - 12 years of experience in quality assurance, with a strong background in both manual and automation testing methodologies.
* Proficiency in designing, developing, and executing manual test cases and scenarios to verify software functionality, usability, and performance.
* Extensive experience in implementing and maintaining automated test suites using industry-standard tools and frameworks, with a focus on enhancing test coverage and efficiency.
* Strong understanding of test automation principles and best practices, including test script design, data-driven testing, and continuous integration/continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipelines.
* Familiarity with mobile testing frameworks and tools, such as XCTest, Espresso, or XCUITest, for automating mobile application testing on iOS and Android platforms.
* Knowledge of web services testing tools, such as Postman or SoapUI, for validating API functionality, performance, and security.
* Experience with version control systems, such as Git, for managing test automation codebase and collaborating with development teams.
* Proven ability to analyze test results, identify trends, and provide actionable insights to improve software quality and development processes.
* Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to effectively convey technical concepts and findings to cross-functional teams and stakeholders.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a keen attention to detail and a passion for delivering high-quality software solutions.

**Key differentiating advantages:**

* Experience in implementing hybrid testing approaches, combining manual and automated testing techniques to maximize test coverage and efficiency.
* Knowledge and experience in testing blockchain applications, including smart contracts auditing and consensus mechanism validation.
* Proficiency in utilizing machine learning algorithms for test data generation, anomaly detection, or predictive analytics in software testing.
* Familiarity with cloud-based testing platforms and services, such as AWS Device Farm or Sauce Labs, for executing automated tests across various devices and environments.
* Certification in software testing, such as ISTQB Certified Tester or Agile Testing Certification, demonstrating a commitment to professional development and industry best practices.

**Educational Requirements:**

* Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Technology, or related field.

**Behavioural Competencies:**

* Good verbal and written communication skills.
* Experience in leading teams technically.
* Ability to communicate effectively with remote teams.
* Strong analytical, logical skills, and team-leading skills.

**How to apply for this opportunity?**

title: Quality Assurance Engineer
description:
QA Engineering Professional


**Job Req ID:** 30636
**Posting Date:** 5 Mar 2024
**Function:** Customer Service
**Unit:** Business
**Location:**25A DLF City Phase-III,, Gurugram, India
**Salary:** Competitive
**Your Accountabilities:**  


**General:**
* The QA engineering professional is expected to deliver the day to day test activities, optimising quality, coverage, velocity and enhancement of tests in the context of the test strategy (ies).
* A key purpose of this role is to be contribute to analysis of complex or new solutions from a test design perspective, including use of test techniques.
* The role contributes to the review of design specifications
* They will plan, design, execute and report of tests, using appropriate testing tools and techniques and conforming to agreed standards to assure the test quality.
* Influencing the testing with business acumen of relevant technologies and applying that knowledge of a technology to the test scenario.
* Performs test analysis on complex or new solutions.
* Apply test expertise in the static testing phases to identifiy defects early, including but not restricted to during Requirements Validation and Design reviews.
* Undertake diagnostics, understanding the complete end to end solution design to work out where the issue exists. Advising the appropriate teams where the issue exists.
* Contributes to the creation of project test strategies in their particular domain, providing recommendations to the test manager based on their area of knowledge.

  


**Subject matter expertise:**  


* May be a Subject Matter Expert in at least one test function, a technical or business domain ideally in Contact Centre Deliveries, Genesys, Cisco WebEx, Five9’s. Where a test specialism is held, the purpose of the role is to improve the quality of testing being undertaken related to their specialism, by applying their knowledge of the specialism to the activities performed by the test organisation.
* Expertise across both functional and non functional testing for contact centre solutions including but not limited to manual and automated functional testing, HA/resilience/failover testing, Disaster Recovery Business Continuity testing, Load/Performace/Stress testing.

  


**Improve quality:**  


* Provide support to improve the quality, effectiveness and efficiency of testing within their business unit with respect to their specialism.
* Supporting the adherence to the test strategy and processes being followed for a programme

  


**Coaching:**  


* You share knowledge and information to directly benefit or support others within the testing domain

  


**Third Party involvement:**  


* May contribute to the creation and execution of a plan to review/monitor the activities of third party test resource

  


**Reporting:**  


* Reporting on the test progress to test manager and appropriate stakeholders both internal and external
* Provides recommendations and advice towards management decisions on matters relating to test projects AND the test organisation in which they work, including new test tools, customer disclosure information, training options for their teams

  


**Skills Required:**  


**Skills for core activities:**  


* Responsible for supporting the stakeholder acceptance teams – including witness testing, being on site with the customer, reviewing test activities, defects, data and test documents produced by third party test resource as part of an established project assurance plan.
* Providing the analysis during a conflict situation when determining where the issue exists e.g. in a component situation.
* Operates methods to assure the quality and coverage of tests written for their area, against the business requirements.
* Able to support, define and lead on day to day testing activities for their area of responsibility (internally or externally facing)
* Establishes and operates periodic test progress and results reporting for key stakeholders.
* Undertakes ongoing analysis of test progress against plan to identify risks to and issues with successful test completion; addresses those risks and issues as appropriate seeking guidance within the test unit when required.
* Supporting the validation of test estimates
* Delivering optimum test execution rates by liaising with customers, vendors, project and programme management alike and reliably delivers results.
* Organises defect triage and diagnostics for complex defects needing input from multiple teams.
* Works collaboratively across all relevant teams
* Perform traceability activities.

  


**Skills for broader activities:**  


* Attend supplier-facing events in capacity as a Test professional, providing assurance of the supplier testing activities and/or services and products, by executing or witnessing on site testing.
* Will have commercial awareness and ability to apply that to their activities.

  


**Cross skill collaboration:**  


* Contributor to BT test Academy/professional community in the capacity of a test professional, supporting test analysis as a skillset of the community.
* Contributor and owner of Verify CI initiatives in the capacity of a test professional, supporting the planning, delivery and execution of these initiatives.

  


**Problem solving:**  


* Identify and resolve any problem within your control or contribute expertly to the resolution of any problems that threaten successful completion of testing to meet project objectives.
* Enhance overall effectiveness and efficiency of testing on an ongoing basis –release on release.
* Analyse production defects, finding ways to discover/remove them before they reach production in future.
* Interpretation of designs, requirements and use cases into test scripts.
* Evaluation of working practice, tools, environments etc. for continuous improvement.
* Contribute to resolution of functional and non functional problems with a test environment or solution under test.
* Solve any problem within your control or contribute expertly to the resolution of any problem arising during the definition and sourcing of the data required for a test set.
* Solve any problem within your control or contribute expertly to the resolution of any problem arising during the set-up and configuration of diagnostics tools.
* Retesting of defects.
* Identification of the likely organisation to resolve the defect identified.
* Solve any problem within your control or contribute expertly to the resolution of any problems arising when associates encounter tool issues.

  


**Change Management:**  


* Managing change control of all aspects of the testing within their remit against the attendant changes in project requirements, design, timescales, priorities, direction etc.
* May make recommendation for the change of testing scope for a bundle/package of test activity when circumstances suggest the scope is no longer valid.
* May make recommendation on the way testing is being conducted on a test project AND as a test team.

  


**Experience Required:**  


**Technical skills:**  


* The individual is comfortable in the role of test professional and has developed a wide spread of skills in the role to which they are assigned, still refer to the mentorship of test managers on occasion, can now perform most tasks unaided. At this level, an experienced tester may now be branching out into a field of test specialism.
* The individual is comfortable in the field of Contact Centre Solutions, across a range of platforms, able to understand complex design documents, identify test requirements and apply technical skills in the identification and execution of tests.

  


**Preferred Technical Skills:**  


* Test automation
* XRay JIRA for test and defect management

  


**Expected Experience:**  


* Senior stakeholders may include Solution Architects, Programme Manager, Test Manager/Architect, Service Managers.
* In order to achieve this, the role requires a minimum of 3-5 years’ experience of delivering testing on complex programmes.
* Working towards a foundation qualification in testing ISTQB or equivalent.
* Working towards membership of a professional body ie. BCS, IET, IEEE or building equivalent, required knowledge and experience (as appropriate to the role).

**Why this job matters**

The QA Engineering Professional supports the critical testing activities for a portfolio of products and services, following best practice standards for test quality, resource planning and issue resolution, in alignment to business strategy and requirements.**What you’ll be doing**

1. Undertakes first level diagnostics, diagnosing defects against components using techniques and tools defined in the test strategy, identifies defects against the correct component in multi-component journeys, writes test specifications and test designs (scripts) and runs the test scripts to time cost and quality  

2. Supports the full lifecycle integration testing to support project deliverables
  

3. Supports the team within its defined area to develop reports on accuracy, quality and errors in test diagnosis against the associated business or customer KPI's  

4. Executes automation, functional, regression and load testing scenarios, applying solutions that validate the functionality of applications  

5. Supports the maintenance of test suites and ensures high-velocity, high-quality production pushes using manual tests  

6. Supports the communication of complexities of internal systems to help test against known issues  

7. Assesses and suggests ways to mitigate risks that have an impact on the quality of products and services  

8. Supports in the implementation of ways to improve working processes within the area of QA engineering responsibility**The skills you’ll need**
Manual/Automation Testing
Requirements Gathering
Regression Testing
System Integration Testing
Functional/Non-Functional Testing
Programming/Scripting
Version Control
Test Case Design/Writing
Agile Methodologies
Software Testing
Software Development Lifecycle
Decision Making
Defect Tracking
Growth Mindset
Inclusive Leadership**Our leadership standards**
**Looking in:**  

**Leading inclusively and Safely**  

I inspire and build trust through self-awareness, honesty and integrity.  

**Owning outcomes**  

I take the right decisions that benefit the broader organisation.
**Looking out:**  

**Delivering for the customer**  

I execute brilliantly on clear priorities that add value to our customers and the wider business.  

**Commercially savvy**  

I demonstrate strong commercial focus, bringing an external perspective to decision-making.
**Looking to the future:**  

**Growth mindset**  

I experiment and identify opportunities for growth for both myself and the organisation.  

**Building for the future**  

I build diverse future-ready teams where all individuals can be at their best.

title: Quality Analyst
description:
**Manual Tester (1 - 2 years)** 

Job Description:

**\\*ISTQB Certifications is mandatory\\***

We are looking for a highly motivated and detail-oriented Manual Tester to ensure the

quality and functionality of our software products. This entry-level role is perfect for recent

graduates or individuals with minimal experience in software testing, offering a great

opportunity to kick-start a career in quality assurance.

**Detailed Responsibilities:**

**Test Case Development:**

Develop comprehensive test plans, cases, and scripts that cover all aspects of functionality,

including edge cases. Utilize various testing methodologies such as black-box, white-box,

and exploratory testing to uncover defects and issues.

**Testing Execution and Reporting:**

Execute test cases meticulously to identify defects and inconsistencies. Utilize manual

testing techniques to assess usability, accessibility, and responsiveness. Document defects

clearly and concisely, providing steps for reproduction and potential impacts on users.

**Collaboration and Communication:**

Engage proactively with development, business analysis, and product management teams to

clarify requirements and ensure a shared understanding of objectives. Contribute to agile

ceremonies, offering insights on test coverage and quality risks.

**Quality Assurance Best Practices:**

Stay abreast of the latest industry trends, tools, and best practices in manual testing and

quality assurance. Apply these practices to enhance testing efficiency and effectiveness,

ensuring adherence to quality standards and company policies.

**Professional Development:**

Participate in training and professional development opportunities to enhance testing skills

and knowledge. Seek certifications such as ISTQB to validate professional expertise and

contribute to personal and team growth.

**Qualifications and Skills:**

A Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, IT, or related field is required, accompanied by

strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Candidates should possess a basic

understanding of the SDLC, be eager to learn, and have the ability to work effectively in fast-

paced environments. Familiarity with bug tracking tools and testing methodologies is highly

desirable.

**Share your resume on Tejesvi.khandale@softpixel.io**

title: Quality Engineer
description:
**Project Role :** Quality Engineer (Tester)  

**Project Role Description :** Enables full stack solutions through multi-disciplinary team planning and ecosystem integration to accelerate delivery and drive quality across the application lifecycle. Performs continuous testing for security, API, and regression suite. Creates automation strategy, automated scripts and supports data and environment configuration. Participates in code reviews, monitors, and reports defects to support continuous improvement activities for the end-to-end testing process.
  

**Must have skills :** Selenium  

**Good to have skills :** Automated Testing  

Minimum **3** year(s) of experience is required  

**Educational Qualification :** BTech  

  

Summary: Role Description: The Tech Value Insight Engine application leverages a host of AI capabilities to deliver on a Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) architecture. The QA role will be responsible for the day-to-day development and execution of test plans to ensure a high-quality product is delivered to the market. Responsibilities/Requirements of the role: • Develop comprehensive test plans for AI/ML models, considering functional and non-functional testing requirements. • Should be able to create detailed testcases to validate the accuracy, reliability, and robustness of machine learning (ML) and large language (LLM) models across different scenarios. • Should be familiar with testing techniques for AI such as input-output testing, boundary testing, ethical consideration, and biases in AI/ML models. • Should be able to understand the interpretability of AL/ML models and the ability to assess and validate model outputs for correctness and explainability. • Understanding of specific domain for which the Al/ML model is designed as it helps in creating relevant testcases. • Knowledge of data handling and pre-processing techniques, as data quality is crucial for accurate model testing. • Responsible for developing AI /ML test strategies and defining quality assurance standards. • Work with AI engineers and subject matter experts to validate the AI-generated content, ensuring it meets accuracy, relevance, and appropriateness criteria, and leverage human feedback to correct and improve AI responses. • Basic understanding on AWS services (ML and GenAI related services) • Strong problem-solving and communication skills, ability to work independently and as part of Agile project. • Develop and refine strategies for incorporating human feedback into the AI model's training and validation processes, ensuring the AI learns from real-world interactions and human judgments. Acting as the Human-in-the-Loop (HITL) mechanisms to ensure the highest standards of accuracy, relevance, and ethical responsibility. Summary: As a Quality Engineer (Tester), you will be responsible for enabling full stack solutions through multi-disciplinary team planning and ecosystem integration to accelerate delivery and drive quality across the application lifecycle. Your typical day will involve performing continuous testing for security, API, and regression suite, creating automation strategy, automated scripts and supporting data and environment configuration, participating in code reviews, monitoring, and reporting defects to support continuous improvement activities for the end-to-end testing process. Roles & Responsibilities: - Lead the development and implementation of automated testing scripts using Selenium. - Perform continuous testing for security, API, and regression suite. - Create automation strategy and support data and environment configuration. - Participate in code reviews, monitor, and report defects to support continuous improvement activities for the end-to-end testing process. - Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure quality across the application lifecycle. Professional & Technical Skills: - Must To Have Skills: Proficiency in Selenium. - Good To Have Skills: Experience with Automated Testing. - Strong understanding of software testing methodologies and processes. - Experience with test automation frameworks. - Experience with API testing tools such as Postman or SoapUI. Additional Information: - The candidate should have a minimum of 3 years of experience in Selenium. - The ideal candidate will possess a strong educational background in computer science or a related field, along with a proven track record of delivering high-quality software solutions. - This position is based at our Bengaluru office.
