title: Quality Assurance Manager
description:
**About us:**
 Intangles is a Global Digital Twin company with a presence across the US, UK, UAE, and SEA. Intangles has an entire end-to-end suite of products where an IoT device captures the data from multiple sensors from the asset which is then analysed on the Digital Twin Platform for predicting component-level failures. The platform can raise early warning to the user and gives useful insight into the performances under various areas and scope for improvement and bringing operational efficiency. The system leverages some of the latest and greatest software stacks to ensure the huge amount of data that it is capturing is being processed and gives real-time insights to its consumers. **Job Responsibilities:** **Test Strategy and Planning:**
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand project requirements and define the scope of automated testing.
Develop a comprehensive test strategy that outlines the approach, objectives, scope, and resources required for automated testing.
Create detailed test plans that outline the testing phases, test coverage, and automation goals. **Test Automation Framework Development:**
Design, implement, and maintain a scalable and efficient test automation framework that supports various types of testing, including functional, regression, integration, and performance testing.
Select appropriate automation tools and technologies based on project requirements and industry best practices.
Develop coding standards and guidelines for automation scripts to ensure consistency and maintainability. **Test Script Development:**
Lead the creation of automated test scripts using scripting languages and test automation frameworks (e.g., Selenium, Appium, TestNG).
Develop reusable and modular automated test scripts that cover a wide range of test cases and scenarios.
Implement data-driven testing strategies to increase test coverage. **Test Execution and Reporting:**
Execute automated test scripts to validate software functionality and identify defects.
Analyze test results and report defects in a clear and concise manner.
Monitor test execution progress and address any issues that arise during automated test runs. **Continuous Integration and Deployment:**
Integrate automated tests into the continuous integration and continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipeline.
Collaborate with DevOps teams to ensure seamless integration of automated tests with build and deployment processes.
Implement automated test execution as part of the build verification and deployment validation. **Test Data Management:**
Create and manage test data sets required for automated testing.
Develop strategies for generating, maintaining, and updating test data to cover various scenarios. **Defect Management:**
Work closely with development teams to understand and replicate reported defects.
Provide detailed information and evidence to assist developers in debugging and resolving defects. **Test Maintenance and Enhancement:**
Regularly review and update existing automated test scripts to ensure they are aligned with changes in the application under test.
Enhance the test automation framework to accommodate new features, technologies, and testing requirements. **Quality Advocacy:**
Advocate for quality assurance practices and principles within the development team.
Participate in code reviews and architectural discussions to ensure testability and quality of software components. **Team Collaboration and Leadership:**
Lead a team of automation testers, providing guidance, mentorship, and performance feedback.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including developers, QA engineers, product managers, and project managers, to ensure successful project outcomes. **Process Improvement:**
Identify opportunities for process improvement and optimization within the automated testing workflow.
Propose and implement best practices and strategies to enhance the efficiency and effectiveness of automated testing.

title: Game Tester
description:
**Company Overview:**

Worklooper is a dynamic and forward-thinking game development company dedicated to crafting immersive and innovative gaming experiences. Committed to excellence, we are seeking a passionate and detail-oriented Game Tester Intern to join our team. This internship offers a unique opportunity for individuals eager to dive into the gaming industry, gaining hands-on experience in quality assurance.

**Responsibilities:**

* **Quality Assurance Testing: Conduct comprehensive testing of game features, including gameplay mechanics, graphics, audio, and user interfaces.**
* **Bug Identification and Reporting: Identify and meticulously document software defects, glitches, and inconsistencies using our designated bug tracking system.**
* **Regression Testing: Perform regression testing to ensure that previously identified issues have been effectively resolved and do not impact other aspects of the game.**
* **Test Case Execution: Execute test cases based on predefined testing scenarios, providing constructive feedback on their effectiveness.**
* **Compatibility Testing: Evaluate game performance across different platforms and devices, ensuring a seamless and optimal gaming experience for users.**
* **Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including developers, designers, and other stakeholders, to communicate issues and ensure a collaborative approach to problem-solving.**
* **Documentation: Create and maintain comprehensive documentation, including test plans, test cases, and testing reports.**
* **Feedback: Provide insightful feedback on the overall gaming experience, suggesting improvements to enhance gameplay, graphics, and user engagement.**

**Required Skills:**

* Enthusiastic about video games with a strong interest in the gaming industry.
* Strong communication skills, both written and verbal.
* Ability to work collaboratively in a team-oriented environment.
* Basic understanding of testing methodologies
* Familiarity with various gaming platforms and devices.
* Previous experience in quality assurance or testing is a plus.

**Education: Btech Degree**.

Currently pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Game Development, or a related field.

Benefits:

* Hands-on experience in the gaming industry.
* Exposure to the end-to-end game development process.
* Networking opportunities within the company.
* Potential for future full-time employment based on performance.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent, Fresher

Salary: ₹10,000.00 per month

Benefits:

* Internet reimbursement

Schedule:

* Day shift
* Fixed shift

Work Location: In person

About the job



Accelerate your career with PradeepIT



PradeepIT is one of the largest, globally recognized IT Consulting firm to connect India's deeply vetted talent team to global customer.



Were headquartered in Bengaluru, Silicon Valley of India. PradeepITs customers include SAP Lab, Bosch, Rolls-Royce, Daikin, Daimler and J&J and hundreds of other Fortune 500 companies and fast-growing startups.



With continuous hard work and working remotely by choice, PradeepIT is certified as a Great Place to Work! Trusted by leading brands and fortune 500 companies from around the world, we have achieved:



6+ Years of Experience



580+ Open source technology Consultant



120+ SAP Consultant

100+ Mobility Consultant



890+ Clients in APAC, EMEA & USA



Our Beliefs



PradeepIT believes in connecting people across the globe and provide them an opportunity work on remotely. Being a people-first organization, PradeepIT constantly strives for individuals who won't just keep up, but break new ground, work with cutting edge technology and ramp-up their skills with course created by our Vertical Heads, Senior Architect for freely with help of PradeepIT Academy.

**Job Description**



Responsibilities :


* API manual functional testing using Postman.
* Good debugging skills.
* Should have expertise in Web /mweb/ App Manual testing.
* Should have a very good understanding of Testing concepts and terminologies.
* Should have sound knowledge of SDLC, STLC, and Agile concepts.
* Good to have SQL knowledge.
* Automation / Execution or any Scripting experience is added advantage.
* Should have good verbal and written communication skills.
* Should have excellent problem-solving skills, ability to work both in the team and independently, and ability to plan and organize the work.

* Help drive the software development process towards quality-centric methodologies, always seeking to avoid defects or find them at the earliest stage possible in the SDLC lifecycle.

* Have a good understanding of bug lifecycle and defect management process.
* Excellent communication as well as documentation skills.
* Experience in cross-browser testing.
* Hands-on automation testing experience in Web/Mobile app testing will be a plus.
* Preferred exposure to the postman, Jira & git.
* Automation exposure with rest-assured/selenium will be a plus.

title: Test Engineer
description:
**Req ID:** 60614
  
**Department:** Tech ARC Intelligent Automation
  
**Division:** Technology
  
**Location:** Bengaluru
  
  

At ANZ we're applying new ways technology and data can be harnessed as we work towards a common goal: to improve the financial wellbeing and sustainability of our millions of customers.
  
  

Our community of over 5,000 engineers is key to making this happen, because technology underpins every part of our business – from delivering tools, apps and services for our customers, to building a bank for the future.
  
  

**About the Role:**  

At ANZ, we’re shaping a world where people and communities thrive, driven by a common goal: to improve the financial wellbeing and sustainability of our millions of customers.
  
  

As a Test Engineer in our Intelligent Automation technology area, you’ll play a key role in the mission to ensure the solutions are tested thoroughly and delivered on time by using best testing practices and some of the best tools. This role is responsible for interpretation of designs and defining testing approaches that enable automated testing and assessment of solution quality. These roles is also responsible for undertaking testing activities aligned to ANZ standard approach.
  
  

Banking is changing and we’re changing with it, giving our people great opportunities to try new things, learn and grow. Whatever your role at ANZ, you’ll be building your future, while helping to build ours.
  
  

**Role Location:** Bengaluru
  
  

**Role Type:** Permanent
  
  

**Work Mode:** Hybrid
  
  

What will your day look like?
  
  

As a Tester, you will
  
  

Bring an engineered test approach executes functional and non-functional tests, build scripts and tools to create and improve existing test automations. Develop test strategies and plans for complex projects in AGILE model of delivery You will collaborate with Analysts and Engineers to solve problems to ensure a seamless customer experience.
  
Deliver test automation approaches, analyse and evaluate test results. You will respond to change quickly, including changing, adding, or improving test cases. As a pragmatic problem solver, you can act collaboratively to work through issues, proficient in driving white box testing approaches and able to prove the quality of the solution through adequate and fit for purpose test coverage. You will provide the ability to take a Risk Analysis approach to testing and demonstrate a quality mindset, to ensure testing occurs early and often. Able to contribute and / or support analysis and design activities (for example contribute to acceptance criteria of user stories, participate in design discussions)
  
Manual & Automation Test delivery end to end including planning and execution of testing activities across various testing phases. Contribute to team agile planning activities, backlog prioritization and management. Identify, verify, report, and regress bugs. Collaborate with product line stakeholders to understand and develop strategies, frameworks relating to their emerging demands. Prepare quality Test reports.
  
Drive innovation/adoption of testing best practices through investigation/institutionalization of New tools/methods/standards/practices
  
  

What will you bring?
  
  

To grow and be successful in this role, you will ideally bring the following:
  
  

A deep practical understanding of SDLC processes including Requirements, Design, Development, Build, Release Management, and Quality Assurance
  
Minimum 5-7 years experience in Software testing in Agile environment
  
Hands on experience in designing, creating and executing Manual test cases
  
Hands on experience in TOSCA, Selenium, Web Driver and TestNG
  
Hands on experience in one or more Test Management tools including Jira Xray, MTM etc.
  
Expertise in Java & Java script
  
Experience in usage of JIRA, Confluence and related tools
  
Well versed with test automation approaches
  
Proven analytical capabilities to evaluate test results
  
Proven ability to respond to change quickly, including changing, adding, or improving test cases
  
An eye for detail, able to identify risks and issues sooner rather than later and not afraid to call them out
  
Someone with a resilient personality who is comfortable with change and able to overcome setbacks as they occur
  
A continuous and pragmatic problem solver that can act collaboratively to work through issues
  
Proficient in driving white box testing approaches
  
Able to prove the quality of the solution through adequate and fit for purpose test coverage
  
Ability to take a Risk Analysis approach to testing
  
A quality mindset, to ensure testing occurs early and often has a broad understanding of how to apply New Ways of Working to their role
  
Ability to contribute and / or support analysis and design activities (for example contribute to acceptance criteria of user stories, participate in design discussions)
  
  

You’re not expected to have 100% of these skills. At ANZ a growth mindset is at the heart of our culture, so if you have most of these things in your toolbox, we’d love to hear from you.
  
  

So why join us?
  
  

ANZ is a place where big things happen as we work together to provide banking and financial services across more than 30 markets. With more than 7,500 people, our Bengaluru team is the bank’s largest technology, data & operations centre outside Australia. In operation for over 33 years, the centre is critical in delivering the bank’s strategy and making an impact for our millions of customers around the world. Our Bengaluru team not only drives the transformation initiatives of the bank, it also drives a culture that makes ANZ a great place to be. We’re proud that people feel they can be themselves at ANZ and 90% of our people feel they belong.
  
  

We know our people need different things to be great in their role, so we offer a range of flexible working options, including hybrid work (where the role allows it). Our people also enjoy a range of benefits including access to health and wellbeing services.
  
  

We want to continue building a diverse workplace and welcome applications from everyone. Please talk to us about any adjustments you may require to our recruitment process or the role itself. If you are a candidate with a disability or access requirements, let us know how we can provide you with additional support.
  
  

/. You can apply for this role by visiting ANZ Careers and searching for reference number 59551

title: Automation Engineer
description:
*With a startup spirit and 115,000 + curious and courageous minds, we have the expertise to go deep with the world’s biggest brands—and we have fun doing it! We dream in digital, dare in reality, and reinvent the ways companies work to make an impact far bigger than just our bottom line. We’re harnessing the power of technology and humanity to create meaningful transformation that moves us forward in our pursuit of a world that works better for people.*  

  

*Now, we’re calling upon the thinkers and doers, those with a natural curiosity and a hunger to keep learning, keep growing. People who thrive on fearlessly experimenting, seizing opportunities, and pushing boundaries to turn our vision into reality. And as you help us create a better world, we will help you build your own intellectual firepower.*  

  

*Welcome to the relentless pursuit of better.*  

  

*Inviting applications for the role of Lead Consultant- QA Automation Engineer*  

  

*We are seeking a passionate and experienced Quality Engineer Lead to join our growing team. In this critical role, you will be responsible for leading and supervising a team of quality engineers, ensuring that all software products meet stringent quality standards. You will implement and manage quality processes, identify, and mitigate risks, and continuously improve the quality of our software delivery pipeline.*  

  

*Responsibilities*  

  

* QA automation engineer to support the development of new test automation scripts and the uplift of existing to handle new features.*  

* Develop and implement quality assurance strategies and procedures.*  

* Support the development of new test automation scripts and the uplift of existing to handle new features.*  

* Assign tasks and responsibilities to team members.*  

* Monitor and track team performance.*  

* Provide coaching and mentorship to team members.*  

* Foster a culture of collaboration and continuous improvement within the team.*  

* Analyze requirements and develop comprehensive test plans.*  

* Select the appropriate testing methodologies and tools.*  

* Design and execute functional, non-functional, and performance tests.*  

* Automation initiatives to reduce functional defects and uncover performance problems early, well before code is released into production.*  

* Automated test scripts to improve efficiency and coverage.*  

* Proactively identify potential quality risks.*  

* Develop and implement mitigation strategies to address identified risks.*  

* Monitor and track the effectiveness of risk mitigation efforts.*  

* Analyze test results and identify areas for improvement.*  

* Develop and implement process improvements to enhance quality and efficiency.*  

* Stay up to date on the latest quality assurance methodologies and tools.*  

* Work closely with developers, product managers, and other stakeholders.*  

* Communicate effectively to ensure everyone is aligned on quality goals.*  

* Participate in code reviews and provide feedback on technical design.*  

* Generate and present key quality metrics to stakeholders.*  

* Identify trends and patterns in quality data.*  

* Make data-driven recommendations to improve quality performance.*  

  

*Qualifications we seek in you!*  

*Minimum Qualifications / Skills*  

  

* Experience designing and implementing automated testing frameworks (e.g., Webdriver.IO, CodeceptJS, Cypress, Jest, Selenium and Jasmine)*  

* Experience creating automated test frameworks, test plans, test scenarios, and develop repeatable application testing.*  

* An understanding of software testing principles and able to drive test automation for different technology stacks.*  

* Experience in writing automation tests (e.g., Acceptance Testing, Integration Testing, UI Testing)*  

* Experience in building automation frameworks integrated with CI/CD pipelines.*  

* Selenium, Java, experience developing API.*  

* Browser-based test automation*  

* Strong problem-solving skills.*  

* Experience with either Python, Java or NodeJS.*  

  

*Preferred Qualifications/ Skills*  

* Experience with AWS and automating UI tests in SaaS platforms.*  

* Experience in automation of messaging technologies such as SNS/SQS, RabbitMQ or Kafka*  

* Experience in performance testing with tools like JMeter.*

Genpact is committed to creating a dynamic work environment that values diversity and inclusion, respect and integrity, customer focus, and innovation. For more information, visit www.genpact.com . Follow us on Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn, and YouTube.*

title: Quality Assurance Engineer
description:
Explore your next opportunity at a Fortune Global 500 organization. Envision innovative possibilities, experience our rewarding culture, and work with talented teams that help you become better every day. We know what it takes to lead UPS into tomorrow—people with a unique combination of skill + passion. If you have the qualities and drive to lead yourself or teams, there are roles ready to cultivate your skills and take you to the next level.

**Job Description:**

**About this role:**


The **Salesforce Quality Assurance Engineer** performs full testing lifecycle for both functional and non-functional testing, Design, create, execute, and maintain test cases, and scripts related to the Salesforce platform. He/She is responsible for providing creation of test cases and working with the developers on releases and deployments, including the implementation of quality gates with QA automation. He/She participates in software specification, gap analysis, requirements analysis, and testing for Applications Development (AD) initiatives to meet business requirements. He/She collaborates with teams and supports emerging technologies to ensure effective communication and achievement of objectives. This position provides knowledge and support for applications manual testing, automated testing, and maintenance.

**Additional details:**

* Will be working on a global deployment of Salesforce Platform Management to 40 countries and corresponding languages, 1000 locations and 25,000 users
* This is a dynamic application that is rapidly growing with new Partner relationship, Language translations and Content Management functionalities
* Develop test frameworks to validate salesforce modules and integrations – Lightning/Velocity components, APEX Class, Triggers, Visualforce pages, etc. covering Aura and LWC
* Working expertise with Platform Management, Service Cloud & Service Business Process (Email to Case, Web to Case, Knowledge, Case Routing, Queues, Public Groups, and User Group Assignments)
* Testing, including defining/supporting user acceptance testing (UAT) and gathering feedback from pre-release testers Perform data updates / migration using Data Loader and other Salesforce tools
* Execute regression test events, testing & tracking of known issues and report on errors that are identified
* Configure necessary test automation software as needed to complete assigned testing
* Participate in software specification, gap analysis, and requirements analysis
* Ability to write clear, detailed test cases
* Performs tasks within planned durations and established deadlines.
* Collaborates with teams to ensure effective communication in supporting the achievement of objectives.
* Strong Ability to Automate test iterations on issues/defects, regression testing etc.
* Evaluate existing test artifacts and design test cases/scripts for new releases
* Ensure quality of Salesforce application development through establishment of testing and automation control gates
* Assist in defining metrics to track completion phase, defect reports, defect prevention, and test coverage
* Work backlog of test plan automation of multiple concurrent Salesforce Modules that have transitioned from Development to Operations and Maintenance
* Conduct Quality Assurance activities to ensure the highest quality releases of Salesforce Modules
* Log, track, and manage issues, bugs, and enhancement/ features requests logged in JIRA/TFS/ADO

**Minimum Qualifications:**

* Understanding of Salesforce, Salesforce architecture and concepts
* Prior experience testing the Salesforce platform and automation of Salesforce application
* Preferably 5+ years QA Experience.
* Minimum 2+ years of hands-on experience in testing of Salesforce Lightning framework covering Aura and LWC
* **Must have Skills:** Salesforce QA , Salesforce PRM, Sales Cloud & Service Cloud , Salesforce LWC components , Salesforce Migration , API , Automation, Selenium , Whitebox and Blackbox testing, Smoke testing
* Ability to write clear, detailed test cases and acceptance criteria
* Experience with latest tools: Selenium BDD with CICD Automation Testing, Copado (CRT), best practices, QA methods
* Experience in testing Content Management, Translations, and 3rd party AppExchange component integrations
* Experience in Security and Vulnerability testing
* Flexible / willing to work across this delivery landscape which includes and not limited to Agile Applications Development, Support and Deployment
* Must be detail-oriented and Self-Motivated Learner
* Ability to collaborate with others
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Bachelor's degree and/or Master's degree in Computer Science or related discipline or the equivalent in education and work experience

**Salesforce Certifications:**

* Platform Admin (mandatory)
* CSTE (mandatory)
* CSQA (desired)

 **Employee Type:**

  

Permanent  

UPS is committed to providing a workplace free of discrimination, harassment, and retaliation.

**Years of experience:**

3-5 years of experience in data testing role


**Details:**

Actively advocates and upholds the standards, best practices and protocols outlined in the Quality Assurance and Testing Framework.


Actively participates in reviews of User Stories (functional and technical), identifies and helps bridge gaps in requirements particularly around use-cases and workflows (considers happy path, alternate paths, user-error, system-error workflows.


Works closely with the Data Eng / Business Analyst/ Product Manager to obtain a thorough understanding of the application and the business being supported by the application. Works closely with the Solution Architect/ Technical Lead to understand the technical approach, technical specifications, non-functional requirements that are integral to the software application.


This individual would be responsible for testing the code. They need to be able to read and understand the requirements and conduct necessary testing. They should be strong on SQL and understand the Data Integration process (ETL) and should be able to mock data in test environment.


Authors Agile Test Plans and Requirements Traceability by ensuring testing depth (# of test cases) and breadth (types of test cases) are commensurate with the number of story points/ complexity and effort intensiveness of the functionalities being developed and tested.


Collaborates with the team to ensure accuracy in estimation of user stories, creation of standardized and/or specific QA tasks to help justify estimations. Proficient in use of tools like JIRA, Azure DevOps in ensuring test cases are tied in with User Stories. Manages test set peer reviews, test plan reviews, execution of test runs, logs and actively seeks quick resolution of bugs based on their severity and priority. Participates in daily stand-up meetings, retrospectives, drives continuous improvement from conducting RCA (Root Cause Analysis) of Production bugs.


Offers UAT support as needed. Maintains primary ownership of the QA environment(s), test data creation and works closely with Test Automation Engineers and Performance/Load Testers. Maintains transparency and predictability for the release by sharing test summary reports at the end of each sprint.


Conducts regular reviews of Quality Assurance Metrics such as DRE (Defect Removal Efficiency), Test Automation Coverage, Functional Test Coverage, and alerts the QA leader to any critical dependencies, risks or constraints and recommends remediation steps.

Familiarity with performance testing like the JMeter or an equivalent testing tool.

title: Software Test Engineer
description:
**Software QA – Analyst**

**Do you enjoy software development?**

**Would you like to develop innovative digital applications to solve our greatest energy transition challenges?**

**Join our Industrial & Energy Technology Team!**


Baker Hughes Digital is looking for an experienced Software Engineer to work on a number of exciting projects that will have a very positive impact on Baker Hughes' business.

**Partner with the best**


You will act as a member of the Software Center of Excellence, representing high-quality design and development practices.


As a Software QA - Analyst, you will be responsible for:

* Acting as a member of the Software Center of Excellence, representing the face of high-quality design and development practices
* Developing high performing, scaling, and innovative end-to-end web applications
* Collaborating with system engineers and software developers to implement solutions that are aligned with and extend shared platforms and solutions.
* Applying principles of SDLC and methodologies like Lean/Agile/XP, CI, Software and Product Security, Scalability, Documentation Practices, refactoring, and Testing Techniques
* Writing codes that meets standards and delivers desired functionality using the technology selected for the project.
* Building features such as web services and Queries on existing tables
* Understanding performance parameters and assess application performance.
* Working on core data structures and algorithms and implement them using language of choice.

**Fuel your passion.**


To be successful in this role you will:

* Minimum 3-4 years of proven experience as a Quality Assurance Tester
* Have good knowledge of SW QA methodologies, tools & processes & experience writing comprehensive test plans & cases.
* Have Familiarity with Agile Software development processes and regression testing
* Have Hands-on with UI/API Testing (REST service testing), BDD
* Have Experienced working with any of the tools- JIRA/Azure DevOps.
* Have Working knowledge of test management software like Rally, TFS, MTM etc. (preferably cucumber).
* Have Knowledge of test automation framework, tools is preferred such as Python, Java & Selenium.
* Have Knowledge of any static code analysis tools like SonarQube, Security analysis tools such as Checkmarks & Quails/Zap.
* Have an Electronics/instrumentation Engineering background is preferred.
* Have Knowledge of Jenkins and JMeter is a plus.

**Work in a way that works for you.**


We recognize that everyone is different and that the way in which people want to work and deliver at their best is different for everyone too. In this role, we can offer the following flexible working patterns:

* Working flexible hours - flexing the times when you work in the day to help you fit everything in and work when you are the most productive.

**Working with us**


Our people are at the heart of what we do at Baker Hughes. We know we are better when all of our people are developed, engaged and able to bring their whole authentic selves to work. We invest in the health and well-being of our workforce, train and reward talent and develop leaders at all levels to bring out the best in each other.

**Working for you**


Our inventions have revolutionized energy for over a century. But to keep going forward tomorrow, we know we have to push the boundaries today. We prioritize rewarding those who embrace change with a package that reflects how much we value their input. Join us, and you can expect:

* Contemporary work-life balance policies and wellbeing activities
* Comprehensive private medical care options
* Safety net of life insurance and disability programs
* Tailored financial programs
* Additional elected or voluntary benefits


#digitalpilot

**About Us:**
We are an energy technology company that provides solutions to energy and industrial customers worldwide. Built on a century of experience and conducting business in over 120 countries, our innovative technologies and services are taking energy forward – making it safer, cleaner and more efficient for people and the planet.  

**Join Us:**
Are you seeking an opportunity to make a real difference in a company that values innovation and progress? Join us and become part of a team of people who will challenge and inspire you! Let’s come together and take energy forward.  

  

Baker Hughes Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

title: Test Manager

**Job Description:**   
We are seeking an experienced Test Manager with expertise in HRMS modules to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate should have a proven track record of managing end-to-end testing activities for HRMS applications and ensuring the delivery of high-quality software solutions.

**Key Responsibilities:**

1. **Strategic Planning: **Develop and implement a comprehensive test strategy and plan for HRMS modules.  
2. **Team Leadership: **Lead and mentor a team of testers, providing guidance and support to ensure successful project outcomes.  
3. **Test Lifecycle Management: **Oversee the entire testing lifecycle, including test planning, design, execution, and reporting.  
4. **Collaboration:** Work closely with cross-functional teams, including developers, business analysts, and project managers, to align testing efforts with project goals.  
5. **Quality Assurance:** Ensure the quality and reliability of HRMS applications through thorough testing, defect tracking, and resolution.  
6. **Test Automation: **Implement and enhance test automation frameworks to improve efficiency and effectiveness.  
7. **Risk Management: **Identify and manage testing risks, providing mitigation strategies as needed.  
8. **Process Improvement:** Continuously evaluate and improve testing processes to enhance overall efficiency and quality.

**Requirements:**

1. Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.  
2. Proven experience of **10-15 years in software testing**, with a focus on **HRMS** modules.  
3. Strong understanding of HRMS architecture, components, and functionalities.  
4. Previous experience in leading and managing testing teams.  
5. Proficiency in testing tools and frameworks, with a preference for experience in HRMS testing.  
6. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.  
7. Effective communication and leadership abilities.  
8. Familiarity with Agile development methodologies is preferred.

If you possess the required skills and experience, we invite you to apply and be part of our innovative team shaping the future of HRMS testing.

Job Summary: We are seeking a highly experienced and motivated Test Manager to join our team. As a key member of the Quality Assurance, you will be responsible for planning, executing, and managing all aspects of software testing for our critical projects. You will lead a team of testers, ensure timely delivery of high-quality software, and collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams to achieve product excellence. Responsibilities: • Develop and implement comprehensive test plans, strategies, and methodologies for assigned projects. • Lead a team of test engineers, providing coaching and mentoring. • Define test scope, prioritize test cases, and ensure efficient resource allocation. • Design and execute various types of testing (functional, non-functional, regression, etc.). • Implement and manage automated testing frameworks and tools. • Analyze test results, identify defects, and track their resolution through to closure. • Communicate effectively with stakeholders, including developers, product managers, and executives. • Proactively identify and mitigate potential testing risks. • Stay up to date with the latest testing trends and best practices. • Contribute to the continuous improvement of the testing process. About Us


Mantra Labs is a global experience engineering & and technology consulting firm that builds intelligence-driven solutions and delivers digital-first customer experiences for global enterprises.  

  

With its 275+ skilled and passionate technologists, the company specializes in providing end-to-end solutions for its clients across eight key industries. Mantra solves the most pressing front & back- office challenges faced by BFSI, Healthcare and Consumer Internet enterprises. Having worked with some of the World’s leading Insurers like SBI General Insurance, Care Health Insurance, Pramerica, Aditya Birla Health and AIA Hong Kong along with unicorn consumer startups like Ola, Myntra, Yulu, BlueStone and Quikr - Mantra Labs has been deeply involved in developing AI-powered technology solutions for business-specific problems.
Why Us?


We are Technology Tinkerers and Experimenters. Building intuitive solutions for our Clients has led to significant milestones over the last 9 years.  

The driving force behind Mantra is its team of change agents who focus on practical applications of the latest technologies.  

You will find us often having animated debates over Node vs Java or RDBMS vs NoSQL Dbs. Geekiness is our thing and we absolutely love it! Freedom at work is at the core of what we aspire to do.  

Be it project parties, team outings, or free Coffee! We like to celebrate our life in the office. Our cricket team trains regularly while TT acts as a quick stress-buster on a hectic day.
  

Our internal library has books from multiple genres to help Mantriks declutter their minds.
  

We have a certification policy to help our employees learn while they earn.
  

Our Knowledge sharing sessions include hackathons, training, trivia, quizzes, and presentations to help our employees upgrade their skills.
  

We have a trust-based leave policy where all the leaves are allotted in one go. No accrual business.
  

We take our Annual Trip very seriously - be it a weekend in Sakleshpur or Gokarna - the whole company goes as one.

title: Quality Assurance Engineer
description:
We’re active members of the communities we serve. That’s why at Stantec we always design with community in mind. We believe growing a great design company happens from the inside out. We look for people who are drawn to use every talent they possess, plus creativity, determination and a drive to do the extraordinary.


The Stantec community unites approximately 22,000 employees working in over 400 locations across six continents. We collaborate across disciplines and industries to bring projects to life. Our work as architects, engineers, and consultants from initial project concept and planning through design, construction and commissioning is built on a solid history of success. So, when we take on a project, we see the opportunity to make a lasting connection with the people and places where we live and work. Redefine your personal best. Join us!


Primary Purpose of Job:


* 2+ years as a professional Quality Assurance Analyst testing applications with high volume and high-reliability requirements
* 2+ Years of test automation experience using Behavior Driven Development tools, Selenium, RPA, JavaScript and source code control tools.
* Excellent communication skills (written, verbal and listening)
* 2+ years of experience in functional, integration or system testing web-based applications desired
* 2+ years of experience developing and executing regression, smoke, functional and performance automated tests.
* Strong understanding of common software development life cycles (waterfall, iterative, agile) and contemporary software quality assurance processes and automated tools
* Capability to work effectively with little supervision and strong attention to detail in a team environment.

customer queries)


* Good level of understanding of Architecture principles, Design methodologies and their applicability
* Deep understanding of Automation Framework types and their usage for creating sustainable automation solutions
* Hands-on automation experience in various phases, levels, and environments i.e., Unit, Integration, End-to-End, System, Functional, etc.
* Hands-on experience in one or more Automation Tools, e.g., Selenium, UiPath, RPA Test Automation (preferably), Cucumber, Integration Tester, SOAP UI, REST API, SonarQube, etc.
* 2+ years’ experience as Software QA

* Experience in people management / leading a team
* Solid experience in Agile testing methodologies and best practices.
* Hands-on and knowledge on automation framework is must.

**Description:**
----------------


Join GlobalLogic, to be a valid part of the team working on a huge software project for the world-class company providing M2M / IoT 4G/5G modules e.g. to the automotive, healthcare and logistics industries. Through our engagement, we contribute to our customer in developing the end-user modules’ firmware, implementing new features, maintaining compatibility with the newest telecommunication and industry standards, as well as performing analysis and estimations of the customer requirements.


**Requirements:**
-----------------


* 4 years of experience in a QA engineering environment related to product design and testing.
* 4 years of experience in QA engineering, writing test cases, bugs, and testing techniques (functional, regression, integration, ad-hoc, etc.)
* Expert in automation framework with Playwight using Typescript.
* Experience in UI automation.
* Extensive experience in web application testing.
* Experience with JIRA or other bug-tracking tools.
* Good understanding of Agile SDLC.
* Effective communication skills, verbal and written. Ability to communicate with both technical and non-technical audiences.

  

  

**Job Responsibilities:**
-------------------------


* Understanding and Analysing Test Requirements
* Writing and executing the manual test cases.
* Automation of the manual test cases.
* Perform end-to-end manual testing of the product, Getting the requirement and creating test cases based on it.
* Collaborating with other teams to manage internal and external timelines and deliverables
* Contribute to the development and improvement of QA processes

  

  

**What We Offer**
-----------------


**Exciting Projects:** We focus on industries like High-Tech, communication, media, healthcare, retail and telecom. Our customer list is full of fantastic global brands and leaders who love what we build for them.


**Collaborative Environment:** You Can expand your skills by collaborating with a diverse team of highly talented people in an open, laidback environment — or even abroad in one of our global centers or client facilities!


**Work-Life Balance:** GlobalLogic prioritizes work-life balance, which is why we offer flexible work schedules, opportunities to work from home, and paid time off and holidays.


**Professional Development:** Our dedicated Learning & Development team regularly organizes Communication skills training(GL Vantage, Toast Master),Stress Management program, professional certifications, and technical and soft skill trainings.


**Excellent Benefits:** We provide our employees with competitive salaries, family medical insurance, Group Term Life Insurance, Group Personal Accident Insurance , NPS(National Pension Scheme ), Periodic health awareness program, extended maternity leave, annual performance bonuses, and referral bonuses.


**Fun Perks:** We want you to love where you work, which is why we host sports events, cultural activities, offer food on subsidies rates, Corporate parties. Our vibrant offices also include dedicated GL Zones, rooftop decks and GL Club where you can drink coffee or tea with your colleagues over a game of table and offer discounts for popular stores and restaurants!


**About GlobalLogic**
---------------------


GlobalLogic is a leader in digital engineering. We help brands across the globe design and build innovative products, platforms, and digital experiences for the modern world. By integrating experience design, complex engineering, and data expertise—we help our clients imagine what’s possible, and accelerate their transition into tomorrow’s digital businesses. Headquartered in Silicon Valley, GlobalLogic operates design studios and engineering centers around the world, extending our deep expertise to customers in the automotive, communications, financial services, healthcare and life sciences, manufacturing, media and entertainment, semiconductor, and technology industries. GlobalLogic is a Hitachi Group Company operating under Hitachi, Ltd. (TSE: 6501) which contributes to a sustainable society with a higher quality of life by driving innovation through data and technology as the Social Innovation Business.

title: Quality Assurance Tester

title: Software Test Engineer
description:
**Job Description:** Software Test Engineer - Adobe Experience Manager (AEM)

**Job Title:** Software Test Engineer

**Experience Required:**** **3-5 Years

**Location:** Ahmedabad

**Job Description:**

We are seeking an experienced Software Tester with expertise in Adobe Experience Manager (AEM). The ideal candidate should have a proven track record of ensuring the quality and reliability of software applications, specifically those built on the AEM platform.

**Key Responsibilities:**

1. Conduct testing activities for Adobe Experience Manager (AEM) projects, encompassing functional, regression, and integration testing.  
2. Develop comprehensive test plans, test cases, and test scripts to ensure extensive coverage of AEM functionalities.  
3. Execute test cases manually and/or leverage automated testing tools (e.g., Selenium, JUnit) to validate software quality and identify defects.  
4. Collaborate closely with the development team to understand project requirements and ensure alignment with testing efforts.  
5. Participate in requirement analysis and review meetings, providing input on testability and quality aspects of AEM projects.  
6. Perform root cause analysis of identified defects and work collaboratively with developers to resolve issues promptly.  
7. Maintain and enhance test automation frameworks for AEM projects to improve testing efficiency and effectiveness.  
8. Define the test strategy and approach for AEM delivery projects, owning all stages of the testing lifecycle.  
9. Document and track quality assurance metrics such as defects, defect counts, test results, and test status.  
10. Collect and analyze data for software process evaluation, integrating findings into business processes to address needs.  
11. Own manual functional testing, ensuring the creation, documentation, and maintenance of tests for existing and new AEM functionality.  
12.  Provide support for production launches, authoring, and validating on publishers and dispatchers in AEM.  
13. Work closely with the team to coordinate test efforts, analyze reported bugs, and consolidate test status.

**Requirements:**

1. Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field.  
2.  Proven experience of 3-5 years in software testing, with specific expertise in Adobe Experience Manager (AEM) projects.  
3. Strong understanding of AEM architecture, components, and functionalities.  
4.  Hands-on experience in designing and executing test cases for AEM applications.  
5. Proficiency in testing tools such as Selenium, JUnit, or similar automation frameworks.  
6.  Good knowledge of Agile methodologies, Jira, and manual testing.  
7. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with a keen eye for detail.  
8. Effective communication skills to collaborate with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.  
9. Ability to work independently and in a team-oriented environment.  
10. Certification in software testing (e.g., ISTQB) is a plus.  
11. Knowledge of automation using Java-Selenium and building test automation pipelines using CI-CD tools like Jenkins is an added advantage.

This role offers an exciting opportunity to contribute to the quality assurance of Adobe Experience Manager projects and work in a dynamic and collaborative environment. If you have the requisite skills and experience, we encourage you to apply and join our team.

description:
Responsibilities

title: Quality Assurance Engineer
description:
Job type: Remote
  

Job ref: 32483
  

Published: 20 days ago
  

Contract duration: 6 months, extendable


Location: Remote


Start: ASAP

#### **Role Purpose:**


Salesforce QA Tester with Katalon knowledge is the link between the business and application development team, verifying that what is developed meet defined use cases.The Test Engineer create test plans, conduct manual and automated testing for Salesforce applications, and provide status reports on the full end-to-end user experience, Findings and work with developers to improve systems.

#### **Context**


We are looking for a Salesforce Quality Assurance (QA) Test Analyst with 4 to 9 years of work experience to develop and execute SIT, UAT, exploratory & automated tests to ensure Product quality. QA engineer responsibilities include designing and implementing tests, debugging and defining corrective actions. You will also review system requirements and track quality assurance metrics. Our ideal candidate will be responsible for Conducting tests before product launches to ensure software runs smoothly and meets client needs. Ultimately, tester should monitor all stages of software development to identify and resolve system malfunctions to meet quality standards.

#### **Role Details – Key Deliverables**

* Test, troubleshoot and analyse software functionality, and user interfaces
* Perform Manual, Functional, System Integration, Regression and UI (User Interface) testing
* Liaise and work closely with Software Developers, Product Owners and business stakeholders where defined
* Participate in feature development and drive quality into development process
* Plan, design, and execute tests the Salesforce (Sales, Service, Marketing and Community cloud) moduleslike - Account, Leads and conversion, Opportunity, Contact, Data loader, Reports & Dashboard, SF Integrations etc., landscape to include all potential use cases for successful negative testing.
* Ensure test cases align with requirements and adhere to a clear set of quality standards and guidelines
* Develop a strong and productive relationship with internal customers (business users)
* For each component of the solution, all individual user stories and its various scenarios are successfully tested.
* Usability testing of the front end customer facing systems – web / mobile app is completed and approvals are secured.Regression testing of the solution as it iterates through changes

#### **Functional/Technical Competencies**

**Test Management**

* Can analyse functional documents, user stories, technical documentations and relevant project documentation and build test cases & scripts.
* Can engage in meaningful engagement with the relevant stakeholders in identifying all the different potential scenarios of each use cases.
* Is able to review existing data (both quantitative and qualitative) and identify patterns that suggests the different test scenarios that must be considered.
* Is intuitive and have a thorough understanding of the Salesforce (Sales, Service, Marketing and Community cloud) modules like - Account, Leads and conversion, Opportunity, Contact, Data loader, Reports & Dashboard, SF Integrations etc., landscape to include all potential use cases for successful negative testing.
* Canorganize and lead initiatives to improve test processes, extend the use of tools / frameworks (where appropriate) and develop team members to improve efficiency.
* Keeps track of test results, bug reports, execution logs and co-ordinate with the technical and function leads to drive the bugs to closure.

**Governance & control**

* Ensure test results are recorded, and a release to next stage is not allowed until critical test acceptance parameters are met.
* Ensure test outcomes are defined for all test cases prior to the test executions, ad test are objectively assesses against such outcomes.
* Is methodical in ensuring that, all assigned testing activities are carried out by the team in the timelines required, and no shortcuts or bypasses are taken
* Maintain test logs and results and ensure test reports are ranked on a risk scale and shared with all stakeholders to enable effective risk mitigations.

**Technical**

* Good Knowledge of Salesforce Applications
* Should have an experience in SIT and UAT of the Salesforce (Sales, Service, Marketing and Community cloud) modules like - Account, Leads and conversion, Opportunity, Contact, Data loader, Reports & Dashboard, SF Integrations etc.,
* Good knowledge of Integrations, CIAM platforms & API Gateways.

#### **Background:**

**Personal characteristics**

* Excellent and careful attention to detail.
* Excellent communication skills are essential, as are exceptionally strong stakeholder management skills.
* A commitment to quality and a thorough approach to work.
* A proven track record in software testing.
* Thorough knowledge of structured test methods and delivery processes (including waterfall and agile methodologies).
* Good knowledge of both manual and automated testing along with automation framework definition.
* Able to organize, manage and prioritize own workload and juniors to ensure deadlines are met.
* Results orientated with good communication and interpersonal skills.different functions and locations

**Minimum experience**

* Bachelor's degree in related field; or equivalent work experience
* Minimum of 6 to 10 years of progressive experience in software development or QA.
* Minimum of 4 to 6 years of automate testing using Katalon
* Candidate should have hands on experience testing salesforce applications
* Candidate should have hands on testing Salesforce (Sales, Service, Marketing and Community cloud) modules like - Account, Leads and conversion, Opportunity, Contact, Data loader, Reports & Dashboard, SF Integrations etc., landscape to include all potential use cases for successful negative testing etc.
* Prior experience testing previous versions of SAP application is useful
* Candidate should have good Functional knowledge/experience of SAP, Salesforce applications
* Should have experience with bug and feature tracking systems such as JIRA, QC, etc.
* Should have experience with Agile and SCRUM preferred.
* Proven track record in assisting with bringing a new product to market and/or major versions of existing products.
* Solid test management background within a fast-paced business with experience using multiple testing technologies.
* Responsible for Designing the Automation Framework.
* Responsible for creating , enhancing , debugging and running test cases that cover various scenarios and test conditions.
* Managing changes and executing Regression Tests.
* Experience in automating scripts using Katalon tool with Groovy, Selenium with Java.
* + Experience in mobile and Web applications testing.
* Excellent verbal and written communications skills.
* Ability to successfully work across different functions and locations

title: Senior Quality Assurance Engineer
description:
MMA is searching for professionals with strong programming and logical skills who can apply those skills to develop high quality analytical software, which helps in generating insights for our clients in order to help them answer key questions, including how to drive more efficient and effective marketing, how to optimize pricing and promotion decisions, improve overall brand and marketing ROI, achieve both short and long term brand and equity objectives, optimize channel effectiveness and better forecast their business. MMA has been a leader in driving innovative analytic solutions for 30 years. In the past six years MMA has grown over 400%.  



**ABOUT YOU**

You are willing to work in a fast-paced, dynamic team environment within the Software Development team. You should possess exemplary focus on quality management, attention to detail, strong work ethic and a commitment to project and data excellence.  



**Requirements**

* Bachelor’s degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science, or other related fields
* 3 - 4 years of software quality assurance & software testing experience
* **Ability to work in Agile Sprint team environment**
* **Knowledge of test automation framework and must know how to maintain existing automation code**
* **Automation using Java, Selenium and TestNG and knowledge of BDD,TDD frameworks.**
* Experience with SQL and test management software (e.g. qTest)
* Experience with JIRA or any other project management software
* Familiarity with regression testing and Agile frameworks
* Sound knowledge of QA methodology and project management
* Strong communication skills and a keen eye for details
An analytical mind with problem-solving attitude  
* 

**Responsibilities**

* Reviewing and analysing system specifications
* Executing manual as well as automated test cases and analysing results
* Collaborating with Quality Assurance Engineers for the purpose of developing effective test plans and strategies
* Evaluating product code in accordance with the specifications
* Conducting post-release or post-implementation testing
* Identify and troubleshoot bugs as soon as they arise.
* Creating logs for documenting the testing phases and defects
* Working with cross-functional teams for ensuring quality throughout the SDLC & STLC
* Capability of Post release sanity testing and perform validation.
* Ability to identify critical and saviour defects and errors in application.
Able to interact with product management and application development teams.  
* 

**The primary job roles of a Quality Assurance Tester are to:**

* Review and analyze system specifications
* Execute test scripts and review results
Report and document technical issues  
* 

**Quality Assurance Tester Job Description**

We are hiring a Quality Assurance (QA) Tester for assessing the quality of our developed software through manual as well as automated testing. Your responsibility would be to find and report all bugs and glitches from our software applications, products, and systems so as to ensure quality production.


In order to succeed in this role, you should be passionate about learning and implementing quality control procedures and should have a solid background in executing quality assurance tests. Secondly, you must have a keen eye for details along with excellent organizational skills. So, if you like to work in a fast-paced environment, and qualify the following requirements, we would like to hear from you.


**ABOUT IPSOS MMA**

MMA is a leading global analytics company that provides Fortune 500 organizations with forward looking, predictive solutions that drives continuous, repeatable and incremental value. The company was founded in 1989, pioneering the commercialization of marketing mix modelling, and through their innovative analytic methodologies and approaches, management of “big marketing data”, predictive software and high-value consulting, MMA has helped companies generate billions of dollars in incremental returns. MMA has offices in NYC, Norwalk, CT and Chicago and is a part of leading global custom market research company Ipsos, who has major offices in over 80 locations worldwide.


**For more information, visit:** https://mma.com/


  
Ipsos is one of the world’s largest research companies and currently the only one primarily managed by researchers, ranking as a #1 full-service research organization for four consecutive years . With over 75 different data-driven solutions, and presence in 90 markets, Ipsos brings together research, implementation, methodological, and subject-matter experts from around the world, combining thematic and technical experts to deliver top-quality research and insights. Simply speaking, we help the biggest companies solve some of their biggest problems, serving more than 5000 clients across the globe by providing research, data, and insights on their target markets. And we’re proud to share we’ve received our Great Place to Work Certification in 2022 & 2023!


  
Ipsos MMA is committed to enabling our clients to achieve significant brand and marketplace advantages by synergistically leveraging unified marketing & commercial measurement and optimization services, data management platform, software and consulting to drive consistent, incremental value that grows our clients’ revenue and operating profits. By taking a more holistic, unified approach to marketing mix modeling, one that


captures all of the marketing and non-marketing variables that have a direct or indirect effect on sales and MROI, organizations are able to more effectively and accurately measure marketing effectiveness, optimize investments and simulate the future impact on sales and profit.

title: Quality Assurance Technician
description:
* · BE Computer Science, BTech, Master of computer Applications (MCA), MSc Information Technology (IT) with relevant experience in Software testing, 3 to 5 years of industry experience.
* · Well versed in SDLC and has hands on experience on STLC.
* · Have good scripting knowledge and be able to create simple automation test scripts.
* · Have good understanding of automation framework to maintain automation scripts, debug and trouble shoot failures as appropriate.
* You write test cases (not test plans) that are high quality, high value, and maintainable
* You have a good knowledge on device connectivity elements like WiFi, Bluetooth and Zigbee.
* You reproduce errant product behavior to assist developers or other testers and identify, track, and accurately report defects found
* You deep dive into the logs to identify errors and provide the failure analysis back to developers
* Test Aptitude: You show a strong ability to find bugs worth fixing. You are a good Ad-hoc tester.
* You provide feedback on coverage, quality of test instructions and acts as a catalyst to process sustenance
* You have good understanding of the automation framework. You contribute to maintenance of automation scripts for respective software releases.
* You debug, trouble shoot and maintain automation scripts and additionally you can create automation scripts based on the project needs
* You analyze automation failures, perform trouble-shooting, debug and contribute to maintain automation test script issues
* You are a customer advocate for the team. You have understanding and empathy for Amazon’s customers.
* You exhibit domain expertise across multiple components or features of a product. You have knowledge of the features and detailed functional requirements of the work well enough to execute your assigned tests, and find gaps in the test plan/test coverage.
* You communicate clearly both verbally and in writing with your team and with other groups
* You develop tools that help improve efficiency/product quality


We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations:
  
  

Chennai, TN, IND
